description:
Tasty food, nice atmosphere, and pretty good price for a Thai restaurant in SF! 

Why I was here // feeling the Thai on a Saturday night with the fiancée

Atmosphere // kind of a hole in the wall, feels semi intimate like a great place for a date or relaxing dinner with family. Very chill 

Food // 
I like that my fiancée and I tried something different from our Norma pad Thai and pad see ew order. 
-crab wonton appetizer - light and crispy! Love this! 
-Tom kha - I get this soup all the time and everywhere. It's delicious!
-chili cha cha noodles - egg noodles were a different change of pace from the rice noodles I am used to. 
- curry with avocado - I forgot the name but it's a chili cha cha special. It was pretty tasty! 


Overall // very tasty and affordable I will definitely  come back especially because they are so close to my place in the city!
author: Emily T.

description:
My go-to spot whenever I'm craving some Asian food! The food is inexpensive, portions are generous, and service is quick/attentive!

My personal favorite dish here is the Chili Cha Cha Spicy Pan Fried Noodles with Beef! If you love spicy food, then you have to order this dish because it's absolutely amazing and just has so much flavor. I recently had my boyfriend try these spicy pan fried noodles for the first time and he was completely mesmerized by how good it was and why he didn't try it sooner! The Tom Kha Noodle Soup with Rice Noodles is also another favorite and very satisfying on a chilly SF night. 

Chili Cha Cha is conveniently located within walking distance of the 24th Street Bart Station. Sometimes I'll order food here to-go, if I'm feeling too lazy to cook (which is 99.9% of the time) and getthe Pan Fried Noodles to bring home. The portions are pretty big and the noodles are able to last me 2 meals!
author: MyTien P.

description:
This review is just for the lunch combination. 

Tucked away within the Mission, Chili Cha Cha 2 offered a solid lunch combination for a reasonable price. Both my friend and I were pleasantly surprised at the amount of food (soup, appetizer, entree with rice) that came along with a reasonable price. The spicy eggplant with chicken was tasty and well-seasoned. The coconut soup was sweet with the right amount of zing. 

Recommendations: Spicy eggplant with chicken (medium spice was plenty)

Pros: Food, service, not too busy, price

Okays: Not much street parking

Cons: n/a
author: Perry H.

description:
Our favorite place for Thai take out. Love the Panang curry with coconut rice. So good! We usually order two and have enough food for two meals for two people. 
You have to ask for chopsticks, they don't include them to your order if you don't explicitly request them.
author: Alex W.

description:
Where is Chili Cha Cha #1? Well my endless streak of exploring Taquerias for Veggie Burritos for weeks on end came to a pause recently as I decided to go for some Thai food in the Mission.

I went w/ the $10.95 Lunch Combo Plate. I got the coconut milk soup for my first course, fresh tofu veggie spring rolls for my second course, & for my entree ordered the yellow curry w/ tofu & veggies having this w/ some brown rice for $1 more.

The coconut milk soup was sweet & arrived first. It was quite hot so decided to have it as my last course. Shortly thereafter my entree w/ the spring rolls arrived. The spring rolls were quite alright as had plenty of veggies as was liked a salad rolled together w/ a sparingly use of tofu w/ a savory peanut dipping sauce.

For my entree I enjoyed the yellow curry w/ brown rice. I requested it medium spicy & it had just the right amount of heat. I also requested some of the hot sauces on the side yet didn't use that much of it as they hit the mark w/ just the right amount of kick.

Service was attentive & felt the atmosphere was relaxed along w/ being fairly quiet. The total for the meal including tip was $15.50. You can easily order a spicy noodle veggie soup or pad thai that would make a meal here less costly yet feel the lunch combination is the way to go for a feeling & healthy meal in the Mission in a fairly relaxed & quiet atmosphere. Of course I will surely go for another veggie burrito at some point yet it is good to mix it up.

Of special note for vegans or vegetarians dining here know that it is quite veg-friendly here as the menu states that vegetarian items & versions are available upon request as they can make anything on the menu vegan. Substitution w/ tofu & veggies is the same price as regular menu item yet  w/ vegetarian meat it is an additional $3. 

I made special inquiry into what the vegetarian meat was & it is indeed vegan yet is made w/ soy & is a veggie "chicken". If it is indeed gluten-free I didn't inquiry yet will be sure to ask next time I come here as much as I love my beans & rice one can only eat so many veggie burritos before having to switch it up changing paradigms like a chameleon like the late greats Prince & David Bowie.
author: Shane S.

description:
One of my Lyft passengers told me about this place -- I'd never heard of it, and I LOVE Thai food.  I can't go everywhere my customers tell me, but a few of my favorite Thai places in the city have been letting me down of late so thought I'd take a chance on this ... and it was wonderful.  Some of the best Thai food I've ever had in the city.  Chicken Satay, Tom Kha Khai, Pad Thai, curries, all excellent. Chicken Satay is worth another mention as it is the best presentation of it I've ever had.  Instead of separate bowls, they put the chicken skewers (cooked perfectly) directly into the peanut sauce, which has been poured on to a rectangular plate, and at one end is the traditional cucumber & red onion salad in sweet sauce -- all those flavors together are amazing!  Serving staff is the nicest and the interior, although nothing fancy, somehow has a calming effect.  I love coming here, I love eating here.  True comfort Thai restaurant.

UPDATE 8/18:  since the original review I have been back here several more times and there have been more items to love, although a few not as much.

The Sweet Pumpkin Soup is ... amazing!! ...  but ask them to use steamed tofu, not fried. And Cashew Nut Chicken is very good.

Dishes that surprisingly didn't do as much for me: Peanut Noodles (def skip), Pot Stickers ('ok'), Pineapple Fried Rice (good, but not of caliber of other dishes, had better), and Panang Curry.  I'm surprised about the Panang because their other curries are amazing, but it has a different flavor than I'm used to, don't love it -- like it better at one or two other places.

Also, the Tornado Beef, the only dish that uses flank steak cut into chunks (other dishes use a different cut of beef, which is sliced), and which is a gorgeously presented dish and has a nice flavor, I found the beef to be a little tough.  I had expected it to be like stew beef where the chunks come apart at the touch of your fork and is so tender -- but, alas, no.  (Ironically,a similarly named Thai restaurant called Cha-Am, on Folsom @ 3rd, does an amazing Panang with stewed beef, although that's the only thing good they do -- Chili Cha Cha is much better in all other respects).

Also, as I said earlier, Pad Thai is very good, although I should add here that they use the Thai noodles for this that are more like vermicelli, very thin, and so it tends to clump.  Some other restaurants use a noodle that more resembles linguine, which I feel is a better choice, doesn't clump as much and has a chewier texture that I like.  But it just depends upon chef's preference (or your preference) on that one -- it's still tasty here -- although, like the pumpkin soup, I'd ask for the tofu steamed, not fried.

But this restaurant is SO good on its other dishes, there is no need to take any stars away -- and some folks may like what I don't (Panang seems to be very popular here, despite how I feel about it).

I am still coming back again and again when I need my Thai food fix!

UPDATE 8/28/18:  Tonight when I got up to leave the restaurant I noticed two young women sitting in the one booth table Chili Cha Cha 2 has (the nicest place to sit in the restaurant), and not only did they have their shoes off, including no socks, but they had their legs curled up on the seat, with feet touching the seats.  Now COME ON, people!  That kind of behavior is just way beyond appropriate, complete lack of respect for the employees and the other customers, and just plain rude.  This is a restaurant, not your damn living room.  Of course, the wonderful ladies who work there were being their usual polite selves and said nothing.  I was so close to doing it for them, but bit my lip so as not to make a scene as the place was packed.  But SO close...
author: Merrick W.

description:
Ordered takeout last night. The food was delicious, the spice levels that we requested were all honored perfectly. And the food was ready to go on time! 

I also appreciated how they didn't automatically add plastic utensils to the bag and asked if we needed them first. (Reduce, reuse, recycle!)

Would definitely order takeout again.
author: Nani B.

description: Chili ChaCha 2 is our go to for delivery. Great flavors and reasonable prices compared to other options. Lots of vegetarian choices.
author: Ryan O.

description:
Great find! I had seen this place for years but never thought to try it out until recently, when they were the only place in the area that was open late. 
I've been back two times since and have not been disappointed. The place is small and always busy. The menu has all of the usual Thai favorites like, fried noodles, curry and stuff fries. 
It's not the beast Thai food in town but the prices are great and so is the food quality. Great for take-out.
author: Antonio W.

description:
The food here was really good and the service was excellent! The ambience of the restaurant was very cozy, and it is conveniently located about a 3 minute walk from 24th street mission BART. We were seated and given menus as soon as we walked into the restaurant. For a Friday night the place wasn't too crowded, which was nice. Our waitress gave us enough time to look over the menu and then took our order. The food came out pretty quickly, which was nice because we were really hungry! 

We ordered the fresh spring rolls as an appetizer, the spicy chicken basil, and the Thai spicy pan friend noodles. All three dishes were very tasty - I highly recommend the Thai spicy pan fried noodles out of all three dishes. You have to order rice separately, but jasmine rice is less than $2 which is nice. Overall, I thought the prices were very fair and I was very satisfied with the food.
author: Rithika V.

description: Good food, the tom kha soup had lots of chicken in it. I like that they have coconut rice. Nice place and good service.
author: Denise G.

description:
Wasn't sure how I would like this place but noticed it had 4 stars so I went ahead and got a table. Ordered the drunken noodles with chicken-wasn't expecting broccoli on the plate. Something was really crunchy but was small-not sure if a chili flake which became annoying after awhile. Liked the rest of the veggies and flavors.

I noticed a lot of folks came to pick up their orders so it seems pretty popular.

I would order here again.
author: Summer S.

description:
I absolutely love Chili Cha Cha! It has become my favorite Thai spot in SF. My go to is the yellow curry, and I also enjoy the veggie spring rolls. Everything I've had is delicious!

There are plenty of vegetarian / vegan options and the servers are very accommodating to dietary restrictions. 

The service is great. I have ordered pick up or delivery three or four times, and each time it has been early by 15-30 minutes! That never happens! 

I strongly recommend Chili Cha Cha if you are at all considering it!
author: M P.

description:
The place can be inconspicuous but they have a sign out front. It looks small on the outside but is actually roomy. There are tables along the sides of the restaurant. So the side that ends with the wall feels like a long bench filled with pillows, while the other side is just chairs. 

They have good Thai iced tea and coconut rice. The coconut rice is 2.50,  just .55 more than the plain rice. I obviously opted for the coconut. The sticky rice might also be a good option. The main courses we got were the namesake with duck and a chicken dish. The duck is really good with the skin attached. But all the food are so salty... I drank so much water, tea, and ate a lot of rice. It feels very much Americanized. I'm also sensitive to salt so it didn't feel like that good of a choice for me.

I haven't tried the dessert here or any of the curries. But from what I had, I feel the food is just too salty and Americanized for me.
author: Lana W.

description: Great curry. Pretty rough phad thai, mind you this was take out, but the flavor came up short of others.
author: J. Bing K.

description:
We went here to get some to-go recently and the food was fantastic! 
Got the pineapple fried rice and green curry with tofu - not very spicy but very flavorful 

Loved the sticky rice and mango as well, usually I like only the mango part but their rice was great.

Parking for a few minutes was easy  to go pick up food so thats a plus!
author: Anju J.

description:
Had my first ever food poisoning from the food here. 

Coworker and I ordered food for lunch via Eat 24(beef pad kee mao and shrimp fried rice), and around 1-2 hours after eating I started feeling nauseous. I then checked in with my coworker and found out that she began feeling ill after consuming the food as well. 

My coworker called the restaurant seeking a refund but they were quite defensive and unprofessional. It took a bit of negotiating back and forth but we eventually did get a refund from Eat24. My coworker seems to be ok now but I had a full 1.5 days of restless bathroom visits.

It seems like this isn't the first time the restaurant has caused food poisoning according to the previous yelp reviews. During the phone call, my coworker had brought up this issue and the restaurant tried to cover it up by saying that whoever it was did not report about their food poisoning quick enough and so there's no proof that it was caused by their food or that the person was just trying to get a free meal? 

All in all, before you choose to step in this restaurant, I'd just advice you to proceed with caution. Also, food poisoning aside, I've definitely had tastier and more authentic Thai food else where in the city too!
author: Mandy H.

description:
Always friendly and fast and the curries are amazing. My favorite is the green curry but I get the yellow and panang too for variety. Also an excellent tom kha noodle soup.

I mostly do takeout, and would caution that it's a very unfancy place in terms of the vibe -- great to eat in with a friend, not so much if you're trying to impress.
author: Scott F.

description:
once a #firstandlastdate freaked out when i inhaled my whole place setting chick was like "did you get enough to eat?!" #lolmybad

n some other chick i scared off bc i'd just finished a marksmanship exam that afternoon. guns muhfuh.

owait those were the same woman.

pshh but w delivery i can do shhh like devour 3 entrees in one speedmeal & dgaf.

(^_^) Ginger Chicken
very aromatic n flavormatic

(-_^) Garlic Duck
didn't taste any garlic, duck so umami

(-_^) Larb "Salad"
don't trip more meat than vegs
funky tang taste chicken

delivered in an hourish, not bad for 3 dishes.
i'd order again in a nitetime hanger attack.
author: Dan B.

description: I was so looking forward to this but so disappointed. I ordered the panang curry with prawns and the duck. The curry was watery with no depth of flavor and the duck was pure fat. Not sure about the other positive reviews? Millennials with undeveloped palettes?
author: Micah S.

description:
Normally I would rate this place at a 4* but since it's the restaurant that witnessed the beginning of my lovely boyfriend & I, it gained a 5 star from me for being "where our love started" 

I've been to a lot of Thai places in San Francisco, the name Chili Cha Cha didn't come out to me as a Thai place until a friend of mine pointed it out to me once and on my first date with my bf, we stumbled into this place and tried it for the first time.

I love this place for 3 things: close to my house, cheap & tasty. I'm sure there are low stars comments out there but people had different experience. 

My go to dish: Spicy noodle nooooom
author: Thao P.

description:
Chili Cha Cha 2 (does anyone know where the original is?) is a great place for cheap, tasty Thai food in the Mission. It's conveniently located near the intersection of Van Ness and 24th, and a nice spot to pick up dinner on your walk home from BART.

The pad thai, pad kee mao, friend rice, curries, spicy basil chicken, and tom yum are all solid and nicely priced. It certainly looks like a hole in the wall, and you'll get maybe one bar of reception maximum when you're eating here, but the service and speed of the kitchen are excellent.

Great place for a quick dine-in or takeout!
author: Tim X.

description:
Because of a lack of good Thai restaurants within delivery distance I have tolerated Chili Cha Cha for the last few years.  But last night's delivery cannot go un-commented upon.
It's bad enough that they use frozen vegetables from a bag (which are easy to identify by the zig-zag cut, see for yourself), but they are simply not even bothering to cook the curry anymore: Diluted yellow curry sauce (also from a bag?) add frozen veg, throw in some of those pre-made fried tofu cubes, barely heat it up, send it out the door.  I understand that restaurants are difficult, but you just have to cook it.  No way around that one.
The carrots and potato chunks were cold and tough. The cabbage was plentiful, and almost crisp.  Tofu cubes: cold and mealy.  It was about 50% potatoes, some carrots, cabbage and tofu cubes.  I didn't find any other vegetables in this veggie yellow curry.  The sauce was lukewarm and bland.  (I make my own Thai yellow curry from various curry pastes available in stores, and all of them have more flavor than this.)
The pad thai, I suspect, is probably also pre-made: sauce from a jar, perhaps?  Boil the rice noodles, stir in the sauce, five pieces of frozen broccoli, five pieces of pre-made fried tofu cubes - don't bother to cook the veg and tofu, they'll get warm in the box on the way.  
Finally, make the pad thai right away then wait 30 minutes before warming up the curry so it is good and dead by the time it arrives.
This place started out halfway decent but has steadily become terrible.  Can't ever order from here again.  Given that I have ordered from here about fifty times in the past five years, I am very suspicious about the positive reviews of this place.  It is very much the worst Thai Restaurant in the city, and that is saying something.
author: Jasp R. G.

description: Today we had dinner here, the waitress is ok, the restaurant atmosphere is very good, my boyfriend and I ordered a special lunch plate, and a  dish of Fried noodle. The plate are very big, but the food are not enough much. Its very difficult to find a parking space. Generally speaking, the restaurant is very general. Basic Thai food is not standard.
author: Yingying C.

description:
The good news - their food is really good! 

The bad news --  if you're ordering it on Grubhub or a similar delivery service, it takes 90+ minutes to get it, if not more! 

I won't be ordering delivery from here ever again...

Maybe I'll go into the restaurant someday because clearly, they have good food.
author: Delilah W.

description: We love Chili Cha Cha 2!  Some of our favorites are the green curry, yellow curry, and vegetable noodle soup -- but we have truly found everything we've ever ordered to be excellent.  Thank you Chili Cha Cha 2!
author: Amy E.

description:
dope.

Try the coconut fries. I was pleasantly surprised. I didn't think they needed the dipping sauce they came with.

I also tried one of their sweeter curries. Pretty high quality standard fare. 

I was happy with the overall quality of the food and the quick delivery time.

thanks for the wonderful dinner guys!
author: Taryn W.

description: I was craving Thai and my partner was craving Mexican. We stopped by Taqueria El Farolito around the block so he could get his massive burrito and then came by here so I could get my Thai fix. We were worried they wouldn't let us bring outside food in, but the hostess graciously let him eat it in the restaurant, which I appreciated. I got the pad kee mao/drunken noodles, medium spice, with chicken. I liked how it wasn't extremely greasy and had just the right amount of spiciness. There were plenty of veggies (bell peppers, baby corn, basil, onion; I opted out of the mushrooms) as well as chicken and it hit the spot. Price was very reasonable and service was quick and attentive.
author: Jen L.

description: I was craving Thai food for days and this place did the trick!  I had the pad thai with chicken.  The portion was pretty big so even though I was starving, I still had leftovers to take home and make another meal out of it.  Prices are very reasonable for San Francisco.  Most dishes are under $10.  Would definitely come back in the future if I'm in the area!
author: Shannon L.

description: I ordered the chicken with fried rice and I ate this for lunch . I work wright down the street. when I went home I was real thirsty then I started to throw up and Diarreha for 3 Days
author: Cindy D.

description:
I've been looking for a decent Thai place for a few years. My old place kinda went under.  Tried this place and it was amazing!  

Crab Rangoon was fantastic! And the tom kha soup was delicious.   Also has the BBQ chicken over fried rice and it was wonderful! 

I'll be ordering from here from now on! 

(And my food came quickly!)
author: Amie B.

description:
Good Thai food with fast service.

Try the Pad see eew. The dishes tend to be very mild so ask for something a little spicy.
author: Vijay K.

description: The salmon with cilantro sauce.  Don't get me started, this place is amazing and has crazy yummy food.  They also have ice cream which is a very important thing in life to have.  They're open late and the neighborhood is so freaken cute!  Go here!
author: Marc R.

description:
Chili Cha Cha 2 packs in the Thai taste at a bargain price ($10 for a generous portion of any noodle dish). While not the best Thai food I've had in SF, it is certainly the best value. 

FOOD: 
- Pad kee mao (drunken noodle) with chicken was flavorful with a higher than average vegetable to noodle ratio (much appreciated!). Expectedly greasy but not too overwhelming. I ordered medium spice, which was truly medium (perfect amount of kick for me To calibrate, I enjoy the jalapenos on her banh mi but not the burning sensation that follows). My one critique with this dish was the bark-like pepper flakes I was unable to chew. I am guessing they were fried to maximize flavor, and perhaps this issue would not arise with the "mild" version.
- Honey duck was the darling of the table. The duck had notes of tamarind too and was sweet but not overwhelmingly so. Duck itself is greasy fowl, but this dish was no greasier than my noodles, and the bed of steamed bok choy it was served atop balanced out the fat nicely. 
- Spring rolls were refreshing and light--I appreciated that these were wrapped Vietnamese style (thin rice wraps) rather than the thicker rice wraps I often see at other Thai restaurants. 
- Tom kha (spicy coconut soup) was heavy on the coconut, which makes the soup mild enough for those who don't like spice. Flavor was nice, but a little sweeter than I like it given all the coconut.

SERVICE:
- Servers were incredibly attentive. I never felt rushed or abandoned. Water refills were plentiful, and I felt at ease as I was asked frequently how my food was :). The food came LIGHTNING FAST. In-N-Out takes longer to dish out my food with much less fanfare/plating than Chili Cha Cha 2 did :). 

AMBIANCE:
- Cozy, laid back ambiance with warm lighting and cushion-lined walls, but surprisingly roomy within. There were ~15 tables inside that can be shifted to accommodate anything from a solo diner to a large group. Given the very short wait time (no reservation, no problem!), this is a solid place in the neighborhood great for a quick bite or impromptu group meal.
author: Helen W.

description:
Have you ever had a duck curry so delicious, so perfectly prepared in a plastic tupperware, so quickly delivered via Eat24, that you couldn't help but order it at least 7 or 8 times in the past three months? I have - and that duck curry is from Chili Cha Cha 2.

Here's the skinny:

1. There is no Chili Cha Cha 1.

2. The duck curry is the absolute star of the show. Maybe it's not the fanciest red curry I've ever had, but it's the one I've always wanted more of.

3. I almost always order delivery, but I've been to the physical location on 24th three or four times and it's almost always empty. We've always had a great experience.

4. Pro tip is to order one duck curry and one pad see ew in order to meet the delivery minimum. Pad see ew is even good warmed up the next day.

Honestly, can't recommend this place enough. I've introduced at least three of my friends to the cult of the Chili Cha Cha duck curry and they've become believers. One of them even asked if we could have it delivered for the Super Bowl, and if that's not a glowing endorsement then I don't know what is.
author: Noah G.

description:
Service: It was more than 30 mins after we were seated that she even came to our table... there was no water and no food till then. 

Two tables were seated after us and got their food before. They seemed fairly short staffed as the place was busy and only two ladies running running around. 

The food: We ordered all the food spicy and it wasn't. There was no heat at all. The Tom Kha soup was sweet and the rice was mushy. 

It may have been an off night but I didn't get anything at this place that lives up to all the 5 star reviews. 

With so many other great Thai places in town, I wouldn't pick this one again.
author: Wildeflower M.

description:
After living in the area for 6+ years, I found that Chilli Cha Cha 2 is hands down the best Thai food in the area. 

Friendly service, super good food (firecracker roll, panang curry, all the entrees and pad thai made with thin noodles are hella good) and some unique chef special items on the menu definitely make this a 5 star establishment.

If you have room, get the mango sticky rice or fried banana! :P
author: Ami D.

description: Solid delivery options here. I really like that the chefs are consistently able to leave off requested allergens (egg, etc) out of the delivery meal. A few dishes I have gotten from here are just not for me, but they were interesting to try. The pad see ew is one of my favs, and also the yellow curry - you can even get a side of steamed veggies if you want to really green it up. Staff is so kind they even called me one day when I didn't order side of rice to make sure I didn't forget. I'm not too far from their location but delivery with eat24 is almost always early- avoiding peak times of course. Mm I could go for some noodles right now. Hubs loves the papaya salad too- perfect for those hot sun-tember mission nights!
author: Coco J.

description: Since I found this place I have ordered from here more than five times either for myself or for co-workers. I love their pineapple rice, it's delicious!! I also recommend their shrimp pad Thai medium heat, just the right amount of spice. I have ordered to pick up and also had it delivered no regrets, my order is always ready or delivered on time.
author: Luisa M.

description: Really flavorful Thai food. Had the silver noodles and pad Thai. I'd recommend medium spicy
author: Adelle L.

description: Really delicious, from coconut soup with lemongrass and galangal to nicely spicy pumpkin curry. Inexpensive. Unpretentious but pleasant atmosphere. Nice range of lunch options, many right up this vegan leaner's alley. Instant favorite.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Pretty good Thai food. Prices are on the more affordable end for SF with filling portions.

My bf and I ordered the chicken pad see ew and pineapple fried rice. Both dishes were delicious and flavorful. They also don't skimp on the meat as there were so many chunks near the end when we were full.

Service was quick and friendly. It seems like a lot of people order take out. I'd come back again if I'm in the area!
author: Sophia H.

description: I love this place. Been going regularly for 6 years and it's still awesome. Great place for dates. The food is presented well, the atmosphere is cozy, and it's affordable. My goal is to try everything on the menu but I often go back to my standard (pad see ew). Great vegetarian meat options.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Someone next to me said, "the food here is so good that it makes me want to cha cha my butt off."

I cringed...but then I tasted the Pad Thai and I am cha cha believer now.

The pad thai uses the smaller thin rice noodles, full of flavor, and has a good mix of ingredients. I opted for the entree portion as opposed to the lunch combo because I wanted more of the Pad Thai.

My family and friends have gotten the honey duck (you can catch flies with honey, but you can catch honeys by being fly), pad see ew, stir fried eggplant, tom yum soup, and coconut milk soup.

Every item has been 5/5. I'd skip on the coconut milk soup since it came out a bit too coconutty and thick for me (though some guys like it thicc)

Chili Cha Cha's "medium" is pretty spicy, so definitely order mild to begin with and just ask for the spice rack on the side!
author: Vi T.

description: You simply cannot go wrong with this place. Lunch specials are magnificent - starting with a creamy sweet coconut soup floated with crisp veggies. I dream of this soup. My favorite is the honey glazed anything, served with coconut or sticky rice. Their thai tea will keep you up all night, so beware :) :) :)
author: SisterMable S.

description:
Ordered one of their pan fried noodle dishes, the Pad kee mao. It wasn't spicy as described. Maybe you have to ask for them to make it spicier? But it was really tasty! The flavors were spot on, and the beef was well cooked. Also had some of the crab rangoon, which was spectacular! I'd highly recommend getting it.

They're also open super late, which is awesome.
author: Jen A.

description: We love ordering delivery from this place! Their dinner portions are large quantities of delicious food. The delivery is also swift and prompt. We have ordered food over 5 times so far, and am sure we will many more times.
author: Akhil K.

description: My 2nd time this week ordering delivery from here through Yelp.  The food is delicious I've ordered pad see ew and pad Thai from here in the past and it's very flavorful.  Recently I've been ordering the chicken Basil dish with a side of jasmine rice and my man loves it.  I usually get the honey duck with a side of coconut rice.  The only reason why I took off a star is because I feel like they don't give a lot of food and it may be different if you eat in the restaurant as opposed to delivery but the food taste great.  I'd probably order again next week because its free delivery.
author: Lennie G.

description: Probably my favourite spot for Thai food in SF. The pad Thai with shrimp, spicy eggplant with chicken and spicy basil chicken are my go-tos.
author: Arka G.

description: If you want to be yelled at and hung up on after your order is wrong you should for sure order from here!! After a large order of $140.00 the order was late and items were missing. I was told that I ordered them wrong and that is was my fault. I asked if I could order those things that I apparently ordered wrong, as who eats curry without rice? I was told I ordered it wrong and was hung up on. Contacted Yelp/Eat 24 and spent 22 minutes on hold and was offered $3.00 for my time...insert eye roll emoji here. We used to order every other weekend from this place and never had an issue. Well never again...and maybe a switch to Doordash after the awful Yelp/Eat 24 customer service.
author: Ariah B.

description: Super fast delivery on a weekend night! All the food was so delicious and spicy, thank god!
author: Malalay S.

description: I love Chili Cha Cha--it's my go-to for a weeknight quick yummy meal to unroll from the day with friends. Crispy tofu is amazing. The only downside of eating here: I really really wish they would fix their door. It doesn't close all the way and it can be freezing if you sit on the wrong side. Plus the servers are always running over to push the door shut. Get it together, management!
author: Kay S.

description:
Chili Cha Cha = FOOD POISONING

Based on the reviews, this seemed like a great place but NOT at ALL! Within 20 minutes of eating my order (your basic thai order) I was vomiting excessively and could not eat for a day. Conclusion: Food poisoning. 

I reached out to Yelp to see what could be done who called the restaurant. The manager did not even apologize for the incident and refused to give a refund. And this is after I left their delivery guy a 20% tip! Poor customer service given the circumstances. I will never eat here again!

Thank you Yelp for understanding how to offer customer service and trying to help.
author: Ashley R.

description:
Chili Cha Cha 2 is a fine spot for thai food if you're in the area, but nothing to rave about. 

I've ordered pickup from here a couple times and both the pad ke mao and pad thai that I ordered were available on time. The food itself was again, seeviceable and about what I would have expected for ~10 dollars.

The one time I dined in here I had the calamari appetizer and it was fairly tasty, although the sauce that it came with was not quite spicy enough for my taste.  Also, word of warning, the door does not close fully, so if it's cold out, you may be in for an unpleasent dining experience.
author: Jonathan M.

description: I ordered spicy pad thai and my girlfriend ordered mild pad thai. There wasn't much flavor in either dish. The spicy dish tasted like noodles with chili paste and the mild pad thai had no flavor.
author: Tucker N.

description:
The best! If you're vegetarian, be sure to ask them to hold the fish sauce.

Everyone who works there is incredibly nice, the lunch special is a great deal, and the food is always amazing. The best things are the tom kha and the pad see ew.
author: M L.

description: Ordered delivery from them many times and the food is great each and every time. Always excited to try something new from the menu cause it's always been great. Thanks guys!!
author: Marc E.

description: Small place, good Thai food with neat ambience. The $11 lunch plate is a very good 3-course option with coconut milk soup, pot stickers and variety of entrees to choose from. I loved Pad Thai noodles and the chicken pot stickers tasted great with the sauces. If you are seated near the door, check whether the door closes properly. It was broken at our time and everytime someone entered the restaurant, the door never retracted and we had to close it to stop the outside cold.
author: Ajinkya P.

description: I ordered the Panang Curry, Pad Thai, and Larb. Only the Panang Curry was alright. The Pad Thai was completely clumped up and tasted like ketchup yet still bland. The chicken pieces were dry and had no flavor. The Larb tasted like old cooking oil but didn't have much flavor beyond that. I won't be returning.
author: h o.

description: Everything is always delicious and the prices are great! Really authentic Thai food in the Mission!
author: Emily W.

description:
When you've dined somewhere so much that the wait staff recognize you and know exactly what you order, I think it's about time to write a review.

I have yet to find the original Chili Cha Cha, but this place is my go-to Thai restaurant in the 24th and Mission area. There's an endless supply of Mexican food around, but only a few Thai places and this is by far the best. It's recently become an almost weekly pilgrimage here, and I get the same thing every time. I should probably branch out, but eh, why fix something that isn't broken!

The vegetarian crispy rolls are my appetizer every time, along with a refreshing glass of Thai iced tea. Before I say what my entree is, I must say: everyone already gives me flak for being picky, so don't go hating on me too! I get a tofu pad thai minus the beansprouts, carrots, cabbage, and peanuts. Don't judge.

It's absolutely delicious though, and everyone has always been really nice. Pro-tip: the door doesn't close quite all the way though, so snag a table close to the back if you don't want a cold breeze coming in!
author: Nikhil S.

description: Pad thai was good but basil chicken and string beans w/ tofu were mediocre. Also, delivery took an hour and 20 mins considering they're only 4 blocks away from my house. I would've been better off picking it up.
author: Abby R.

description: Ordered delivery. Food is substandard and had to call several times to get a proper eta and it took an hour and 50 min for the food to be delivered.
author: Anand N.

description: I love Thai food, but I really love chili cha-cha 2. I don't know what they do so magically but the curries, the soups, the appetizers, all taste delicious. Also if you're vegan, they are totally able to accommodate.
author: Anne S.

description: Ordered for Delivery! Foods was Good! My coworkers and I loves it! Fast delivery every time!
author: Jan A.

description: Average place. The pad Thai was extremely sour. I didn't receive any utensils in my bag. The lady said she would put hot sauce in my bag but didn't. The mango and sticky rice was drenched in coconut milk, so it was extremely sweet I wish they put it on the side that's how other places usually do it. I'm not impressed at all.
author: Michelle N.

description: Wasn't impressed. The pad thai was too sweet, had a weird taste. Larb was overly seasoned, tasted like too much shrimp paste or something else that was really gritty ( think sand texture ).  Overall I  wouldn't order from here again.
author: Nancy P.

description:
I've been here many times as it's close to my apartment and I've enjoyed each visit! 
I usually get the Pad Thai, which is always great, but they also have many other menu items which I'm looking forward to trying. The portion sizes seem perfect and the presentation is also quite good. The place is great for both take-out and dine-in and the prices are quite reasonable too. Overall, Chilli Cha Cha 2 is a great, reliable place for Thai food and since it's open until 11pm most days, I'm going to have many more dinners here in the near future! :)
author: Sahil S.

description: Best Thai food in SF! Seriously, everything I have ordered is on point. Always hot and delicious. Not fancy dancy but the food is the star. My favorites : papaya salad Extra spicy and Tim yum shrimp! Also extra spicy! Oh babyyyyy
author: esme R.

description: I absolutely love Chili Cha Cha 2. I eat here regularly and I've never been disappointed. The Tom Kha soup is the beat I've had!
author: Sarah W.

description:
My favorite restaurant in san francisco!!!! 
 The best food 
Nice price 
Nices staff 
My favorite dish the pad see eew
author: David C.

description:
I went here with my partner as we found ourselves hungry in the Mission District.  She was there for lunch a couple of weeks earlier and she ordered pot stickers with her special and instead received an egg roll.  After bringing it to the servers attention the server proceeded to tell her that she indeed had ordered the egg roll.  The pot sticker never came. 

On our visit we ordered the Green Curry with chicken and the Cashew Nut Chicken.  The curry was unremarkable and the Medium spice that I ordered didn't have a tint of heat. The Cashew Nut Chicken on the other band was very good, as the cashews contained a smoky grilled taste that really enhanced the dish.  We also ordered the Fresh Spring Roll.  These rolls came to the table first and were presented very nicely with a traditional peanut sauce.  The sauce was nothing to write home about but after we each took a small piece of the roll, I didn't see a shrimp in mine.  My partner didn't either. There was tofu in the roll as was advertised on the menu but no shrimp that we could see or taste. After calling the waitperson to our table she told us that there was indeed shrimp in the roll and pointed to the reddish color on the side of several of the rolls. The lighting in the place was dim and she walked away.  I opened two of the rolls and that reddish substance was carrot not shrimp.  We left the uneaten dish on our table through the completion of the meal.  

After we had completed our dishes the server came by and asked us how our meal was.  I pointed over to the plate with a couple of the rolls opened and unrolled and again proceeded to tell her that there were no shrimp only tofu.  She looked and smiled as she took the dish away from our table. At this point I fully expected to have this item taken from our bill.  But guess what?  They charged me.  

My partner then relayed to me her past experience when the server ( a different lady) told her that she ordered an egg roll instead of a pot sticker. She thought that it could be a language problem. I did not agree as our server repeated our order to us after we gave it to her.

Chili Cha Cha 2 offers up unremarkable Thai food.  From our table we could see that they do a phenomenal take out business. But for the life of me, I don't understand why as San Francisco has so many great Thai Restuarants..

Unfortunatley, Chili Cha Cha 2 is not one of them.
author: Nick C.

description: Great Thai place for the price in the mission! Lots of options (veggie+meat, folks who like their food mild or spicy). Great portions as well, it's def my go to!
author: Vinay P.

description: Love the pumpkin curry and pad kee mao. It's therapeutic:):)
author: Bubble T.

description: Been ordering lunch for the office... good food and nice people...curry is good and appetizers too
author: Arlo U.

description:
Idk WHAT the bad reviews are about--I eat here a lot and it's delicious every time. I'll ether pick it up or get it delivered. 

Staff is ALWAYS super nice via phone and in person.

Affordable, and everything I've ever tried from here tastes great! 

Pad Thai, pad see ew, tom yum, tom ka, spring rolls, veggie spring rolls, yellow curry, papaya salad...literally could go on and on about the food and how it's awesome along with the staff. 
I'm pretty sure I have nothing bad to say about this place-it's my go-to for fast and yummy hot food that's close by!
author: Mandy F.

description: Very dry beef and the duck is too salty. Overall pretty disappointing neighborhood eatery but the server was very nice and the food came out relatively fast. Tom kha was thick and sweet though and not bad at all.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Everything on the menu is delicious but they frequently get their orders wrong for delivery - not  entire dishes, but protein. Shrimp when you order chicken, tofu when you order shrimp, etc. In my experience it's been almost entirely random.

The food is all good, but if you have any dietary restrictions I would avoid ordering for delivery.
author: Randy M.

description: Not quite an authentic place. I ordered the Tom Yum noodle soup and it was very Americanized with bland boiled chicken, bean sprouts, and flat rice noodles of a super soft texture. The soup was also different from the creamy, silky, spicy and sour Tom Yum. It's just a spicy broth without much flavor. But no complaints about service and if you are happy with westernized Thai food this might be good
author: Alex L.

description:
I went to have lunch here with pad thai combo. It was ok but was too sweet for me. 

For the mango sticky rice was not bad. Only sticky rice too soft and too sweet. 

The service was ok :)
author: Pinarat S.

description: Excellent food overall, to wit, Tornado Beef, Salmon Roll, Honey Duck, and Lamb Pumpkin Curry. Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description:
I. Love their fried calimari rings! 
Servers should pack things that can spill and cause a mess in amp plastic bag . Packed in paper bag and made a mess.. Food was otherwise good though.
author: Alexander T.

description:
This is my favorite go-to place en route home from BART.

I've been here probably a dozen times for dinner by now, mostly dine-in, and it is an exceedingly low key (casual, but nice) dining experience. It seems their kitchen is kept busy with a high volume of pickup and delivery orders, but simple dishes for in-house dining still arrive pretty quickly.

As someone with shellfish and nut allergies, Thai food can be a terrifying prospect. This place feels safe in that they don't sprinkle gratuitous peanuts over every dish (though I do still ask for none every time, just in case), and they are very accommodating to alter your order in other ways.

I order basically the same thing every time: yellow curry with chicken. I also add extra vegetables, so that you're not just eating potatoes. This gets you more cabbage, carrot, and broccoli, yay colors. Not sure if they tack on extra $ for that.

Crispy vegetarian rolls are perfect to split with 2-3 people (you get 6 cross-cut halves).

Thai and lychee iced teas are nice and sweet and peppy (lychee tea has a whole fruit at bottom), but nothing special here.

Sweet pumpkin soup is really quite sweet. It is too sweet for me for a main course, and I like sweet. Maybe save it for a nuggety dessert, instead.

Friends have been happy with the Pad Thai and Pad See Ew, and fried rice was another simple tasty meal that provided me a little breakfast the day after :)

Single bathroom is always clean, but a little uncomfortable to wait in line for, since it's right next to the kitchen.

Oh, and one of these days I will ask why Chili Cha Cha /2/. I still haven't found any evidence of Chili Cha Cha 1...!
author: Olivia G.

description: Yummy yummy you make me very happy. Go to place any day any mood dude and the service is on nice thanks y'all
author: Juñior A.

description:
The worst!

I really DONT recommend this place at all. If i can give them negative stars i would cause one star is a good rating for them 

After 30 min of submitting my order and receiving a confirmation they decided that they don't want to deliver my food.
author: Mohamed M.

description: I love to order delivery from here. Fast, affordable, delicious. I've been ordering for years and never been in the place. Funny...
author: Emily G.

description: I'm Thai, living in Seattle. On a recent trip to Sf. I visited Chili Cha Cha2. I ordered Pork Pad See Eww, Chicken Green Curry and Pork Spareribs and Sticky Rice. The food was delicious and authentic, just like eating food in Thailand.  The service was excellent. If you are in the area, i would recommend you stopping by.
author: Kokadoo D.

description:
(3.5) I spend a lot of time around the 24th st. BART so I come here often. The food here is good and reasonably priced. The level of spice is high and a bit variable. Sometimes medium is a little spicy. Sometimes it's murderously spicy. Still, don't let this detract from the food. It's of decent quality and very consistent. This place also accepts credit cards, which is always a plus in the Mission.

I typically go for the Pad Thai: The noodles are very tasty but they skimp on meats and include tofu and ~2 ounces of sprouts in even the meat Pad Thai. Understandable for a restaurant trying to keep costs down, but some customers may be put off by that. Still it's a good meal, for a good price, and their Yellow and Pumpkin curries are solid as well.

Start off with mild to be safe if you're sensitive to spice.
author: Irina P.

description: Finally we found our go-to thai food spot in San Francisco!  We always get takeout or delivery, so I can't speak to the ambiance of the restaurant itself, but the food is consistently good.  The portion sizes are reasonable for the price, delivery is fast and friendly, and overall we've never had a bad experience.  My go to dishes are the lamb pumpkin curry, pad kee mow, and pad see ew.
author: Riley D.

description:
I don't remember the last time I've given a one star review, if ever. However, I'm sorry to say that the food here is just not good.

This may have very well been the worst Thai food I've eaten, and I've eaten at a number of Thai restaurants.

I had their lunch combo.

Soup: it just seemed like veggies floating in hot coconut milk.

Spicy string beans: way too greasy. Oil was all over the plate.

Pad Thai: it did not taste like pad Thai and had too much fish sauce.

Crispy tofu: this appetizer was okay - only because it's literally just fried tofu.

Vegetarian potstickers: too much sauce poured on top of them.

Overall, I would much rather not have eaten this food. 

To end on a positive note, the ambience of the place is nice and the rice is cooked well.
author: Raakin H.

description: One of the best Thai food experiences I've ever had. After moving to Orlando, my food standards may have plummeted, but the food here is legit. I highly recommend the green curry and Pad Kee Mao!
author: Johnny S.

description: "Chili cha cha = chili fye fye " words from my husband. lol best Thai food place we've found since living in mission district. Truly love the broccoli wok and pad see ew. Always delicious. Definitely recommend coming here.
author: Megan I.

description:
This is delicious. Quick delivery but I recommend calling them directly instead of ordering through eat24. (Eat 24 is annoying because not all orders go through for some reason.)
Chicken green curry is great
Pumpkin curry is great
Tasty and close by our house
People there are super nice
Mmm!
author: Gillian K.

description:
Delicious thai food.
Prices are really good. Thom Kha soup & Green Curry highly recommended.
author: Ava F.

description: This is one of my favorite places to grab dinner in the Mission. When every other restaurant in the block serves the same Mexican food, Chili Cha Cha is a welcome relief. I like their curries, they go well with coconut rice. The portion size is just right: big enough that I go home satisfied but small enough that I can finish it. The prices are quite affordable too. 5/5
author: Bai L.

description: Whenever it gets late on 24th St, it's either tacos or... Chili Cha Cha! They are open till 11pm. I love picking up some late night noodle takeout for a warm almost-midnight-snack. Great service and friendly, whether eating in or to-go. One of my favorite dishes is something they call Suki Yaki on their menu - a warm, mild, comforting meal...very understated on their menu, but big tasty portion.
author: lesley f.

description: Probably a 3.5 on food, but a true 5 star on value. Their lunch specials are plenty tasty and a ridiculous deal. The garlic and pepper is pretty solid. The apps are nothing to write home about and probably the most overpriced part of the menu. The coconut curry soup is really good.
author: Aaron A.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco. I am vegetarian and prefer going vegan when eating Thai food and they really deliver. The noodle soup, pumpkin soup, fried rice, spring rolls and samosa are consistently delicious. Their service is friendly and it's my go-to place when I am in the mood for takeout.
author: Dipti D.

description:
1 star edit: have eaten here twice in the last year and gotten food poisoning. 
Pad Ke Mao and Duck Curry. Bad experience and won't be here again


5 star initial review:
Ordered: Bacon Loves Scallops & Duck Curry. Rice came separate.

Let's just say it was so delicious I can't wait to get home and eat the leftovers. My mouth is watering as I type this.
author: Trevor M.

description:
I came here with a friend, who comes here often. First off, this place is divy little thai restaurant in the, wait for it....the Mission, surprised? Lol. If you are a SF local you know what I mean;) 

Anywho, off to the real deal here, the food and service. 

Though we were greeted pretty quickly, we had to wait a bit before we were waited on, annoying when it wasn't busy, and it was a week night. The menu is your typical thai stuff. My friend got the yellow curry with pumpkin and chicken, I got the tom yum soup, vegetarian style (fyi-which includes braised tofu, which I would have known, I would have asked for regular tofu), and the papaya salad since my friend raved about it from eating before. The papaya salad was good, but I have had better. It was bit too marinated in the sauce and not the right flavor, something was missing. My friend liked his dish, it looked good. As for my soup, it was okay, good for a cool night in SF, but uneventful overall.  

The waitress never came back to wait on us, though the place was not busy, and it was a week night nonetheless as I mentioned before. We even had to find the waitress all the way in the back of the place to to get the bill to pay. 

All in all, it was okay thai place if you are in the area and need a quick thai fix. Being a foodie, I am not sure if I would make effort to come back, since there alot of great thai places in SF to try. But I wouldn't mind if coming back, if my friend wanted to, and maybe trying the vegetarian salad. It did sound good.
author: Sonia A.

description:
I started going here because I had a very, very bad cold. The kind where it hurts so bad to swallow that you cry a bit each time. Someone on the internet said that Tom Kha soup helps. I had theirs. Tom Kha soup is a plain delicious soup with some interesting vegetables - some a bit tricky to chew - all of which combine to be healthy and nourishing. It's very, very delicious.  I went here every other day for 8 days, and ordered the vegetarian Tom Kha soup (large size) and it was the sweetest relief. Some other reviewer said the Tom Kha is too sweet - I hate sweet food, it doesn't taste sweet to me. Sometimes I would have a bit of white rice with it.

They also have nice fresh meal choices, aside from the soup. I love their vegetarian spring rolls - they are very refreshing and subtly flavored. The lunch specials are very cheap. But at the end of the day, I will always order Tom Kha soup when I come here.

The staff are friendly and sweet - I think this restaurant deserves a lot more attention than it gets.

Edit: the Tom Kha soup no longer comes with spices automatically added. For the medicinal properties discussed above, please request spicy Tom Kha soup. 

Also, I have since tried other dishes and I don't order this every time now. Their Pad See Ew is also very good.
author: A T.

description: This review is only for food as I ordered delivery.  I was excited to finally order from one of my neighborhood spots, especially after reading the good reviews.  After ordering, they were swift and friendly in their delivery.  Unfortunately, the meal itself wasn't great.  The samosas, made with puff pastry, were mushy and falling apart.  The papaya salad was pretty good, but 2/3 of the dish was lettuce leaving only enough for a side for 1 person.  The Tom Kha was far from authentic, but popular amongst the other reviewers - so I reduce it to a matter of taste on that one.  I won't be ordering from here again, but I'm sure they have some good stuff.
author: Jenn T.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night around 9:15. Place was fairly empty, with only 2-3 tables occupied, so got a seat quickly and great service throughout. They filled my water every time the glass was half empty. Cozy little place, and a nice casual feel. 

Most of the usual Thai staples on the menu, and some tasty-sounding specialties as well. Was only 2 of us and we weren't that hungry though, so went minimal in our ordering. Prices were pretty good: ~$25 total for 2 of us, though we did eat light. We got:
- a bowl of Tom Yum, with prawns: lots of mushrooms, good bit of shrimp too, and great flavor. HUGE bowl, could easily be one person's meal, or shared between 2-4. Spicier than I expected too, as we ordered medium, but not a problem for me.
- papaya salad: tasty, and nice lightly spicy sauce, which is sometimes drenched on and sometimes sadly absent, so done fairly well here. Presented beautifully too. 
- side of jasmine rice

Overall, pretty happy with what we got, and our experience. Nothing blew me away, but seems like a great local/neighborhood Thai joint, that wasn't crowded pleasantly.
author: Kris K.

description: I love this place! I order our staff meeting lunch from here and they never fail in delivering on time. The food is also great! Can't go wrong with any of their curries whether it be with chicken or vegetables.
author: Dean S.

description:
Pretty good Thai food for the price. I live just down the street, so I haven't experienced dine-in (takeout ftw). Quick turnaround for my orders, typically and a very friendly staff. 

I've been pretty happy with most of the dishes I've ordered. Expect A LOT when you order curry, though. Nice, spicy kick to most of the entrees, as well. Which I really appreciate.
author: Kyle K.

description: I'm sad.  I think I had a one-off bad experience with the food.  It seems like a nice place, clean, beautiful inside, friendly, smiling, happy staff.  Anyways, I ordered the Tom Kha soup and there was no lemongrass in it and the flavor was pretty absent unfortunately.  I asked them to add lemongrass and sent it back to the chef.  They put some sliced up curls of some type of root vegetable in there, and it tasted slightly like lemongrass but was a little different.  Some of the chunks were really hard, too, and I accidentally bit into it and hurt my tooth.  There were a few other chunks of things in there that tasted like raw turnips or something and definitely uncooked.  I really wanted to have a nice experience.  Maybe I will order something different next time.
author: Sarah R.

description:
Bummer. Eaten here over a dozen times and always decent. Came in tonight for take out and ordered spring rolls when I meant pot stickers. They refused to waive the rolls!  I was in utter shock. 

It will be my last meal from this place.
author: Chris P.

description: This is best Thai delivery in town. I love how their vegetarian options come with a good mixture of vegetables. I would give 5 stars to everything I ordered tonight - vegetarian tom yum, chicken pot stickers, vegetarian pad see ew. So so good.
author: Liz R.

description: Did the lunch combo for $9.95 coconut milk soup, fresh spring rolls & yellow curry. Super full and satisfied! Would visit again!
author: Tea D.

description:
This is a perfect place to stop in for an excellent Thai lunch. They never disappoint!

For the lunch menu, you have a choice between soup or salad to start. I always get the soup, which is a variety of vegetables (carrot, baby corn, mushroom, cabbage) in a delicious coconut lemongrass broth.

Next is a choice of appetizers, that come with your entree: potstickers, spring rolls, chicken satay, etc. The fried tofu was the only one I found a little boring (imagine fried tofu, it can be boring). The spring roll is basically a salad, so usually I get that to compliment the soup.

For entrees, there are a dozen or so. Typically, I'd get the spicy eggplant or one of the curries. Order "Thai spicy" if you want it properly hot. It comes with rice, which you can upgrade to brown or sticky rice if you like.

Lately, I've been working my way down the menu to try everything, and so far it is all good. You can order each item with either chicken, pork, tofu, or beef. Or for extra make it shrimp, seafood combo, duck, or seitan. Each dish seems to call for a different meat, but chicken will fit the bill for any of them.

The portions are perfect for lunch, not too much to make you overfull and tired, but not too little to leave you wanting.

If you are looking for a Thai lunch in the Mission, this is the place to be.
author: Andy B.

description: Wish I could say better things, but my experience here was really "meh" :(
author: Sahana U.

description:
This place makes a decent green curry, but the pad see ew and tom kha soup are fairly mediocre. The amount of rice that you get per order is also somewhat limited.

I also would not order spring rolls again, there was just so much cabbage and very little of anything else. The peanut sauce that came with it was quite good though, so perhaps the satay would be a better choice.

I like the green curry from here better than the equivalent from Manivanh on 24th, but I'd probably get anything else from another thai restaurant given equal convenience.
author: Alexander L.

description: Randomly choose this spot as I was walking by. Small little spot with a casual and comfy atmosphere. Tried the spicy tai salad with beef since I wanted something light. Wow! This was tasty and medium spice as ordered. The waitress was very nice and hospitable. The price was no more the ten buck which is average. I loved the soft bench with pillow....so nice at the end of a stressful day. I will be back to try something different from the menu :)
author: Roseanna C.

description:
I love rating everything on a 1-10 scale.  As far as Thai food goes, I think it's pretty hard for it to be below a 4 and equally hard for it to be over a 7.  Chili Cha Cha 2 perfectly proved my theory and earned a solid 6.  

Overall, the food was slightly above average for Thai.  I was with a friend and we ordered my 2 favorite Thai dishes: Pad See Ew with beef and Panang Curry with chicken.  They were both good and decent sized portions.  The Pad See Ew was a little greasier than usual while the Panang Curry could use some work on the vegetable to chicken ratio (too many vegetables, not enough chicken).  The servers were nice and attentive but the restaurant was also empty.  

I should also note that they're coconut juice was delicious and had plenty of fresh coconut pieces to make this coconut lover extremely happy.

I'll probably end up going back to Chili Cha Cha at some point when I'm desperate for a quick Thai meal in the Mission but it's nothing out of the ordinary.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Now that Eat24 is a part of Yelp, I don't think it's out of place to review my delivery experience here. 

I've been a fan of Chili Cha Cha 2 and have ordered from them several times. However, lately they've been giving me estimates of 45-60 minutes on Eat24, but the food isn't coming until 75-90 minutes. I could live with this and just assume the 75-90 minutes, but the food is arriving tepid. I live about a mile away, so I can only assume that it's sitting around or in the car for 30 minutes or longer. Since I don't own a microwave, this is somewhat inconvenient. 

The food is generally good, but at this point I think I have to find a different place to get my Thai food. It's a shame because they used to be fast and hot. This has been going on for a couple of months now, so I don't think it they're going to be fixing this any time soon. As of this moment, I've been waiting an hour and a half for my latest order (NO exaggeration). No sign of my food. WTF?
author: Adam N.

description: Admittedly I only had the spring roll but there was one piece of shrimp in it which was ridiculous considering it was $8. What a waste of money.
author: Xteethx B.

description: I like this place and they deliver which is great! Some items are hit and miss but mostly every thing is pretty good.
author: Maxwell L.

description: Food + disturbing experience. I've eaten here many times. Last few months the food has been better than ever, fresh and really flavorful. Came in for a quiet supper after an endless seeming workday. The tom yum soup delicious. Half way through my meal a very strange thing happened: a man walked in, fairly put-together looking but obviously really inebriated. Waitperson asks what she can do for him. I look up from my plate as he blurts out ' I want some wine'. Now its obvious the guy is f@cked up.  She just steps aside and goes toward another table. Guy walked through the restaurant, straight at me. I'm sitting on the bench, table in front of me, by myself. He leans in, grabs my glass of wine while saying loudly 'can i have this?'. I was startled, said no, that's rude, you have to go. He leaned more. I stood up. He walked out. Never did a waitperson or other staff ask if I was ok, offer to refill the glass he spilled or anything else. BTW I'm an older woman and probably the smallest person in the place. Weird. Not sure I would go back.
author: Inez I.

description: We get take out all the time. Its terrific. Great dishes are toronado beef, spicy eggplant, and chee choo talay, amongst others.
author: Fraser H.

description:
This is my go to, no-frills Thai place for take out. It's a very unassuming place (so I wouldn't try it for a first date), but the food is extremely good. Great for big groups if you're looking for a quieter spot that you can take over.

Pumpkin curry is EXCELLENT. All the curries are, actually.
author: Alex L.

description:
I absolutely love this place. Very homey and friendly staff.

My usual: String bean beef, crab fried rice, pad sew ew, bacon wrapped scallop and dressing prawn. All killer dishes, especially the crab dish.
author: Kelly W.

description: Best Thai in the city! They are extremely nice, care about their customers, and serve a lot at an affordable price. Their great quality and Thai favorite keeps bringing me back. They always know what to suggest in case your not sure what to order and it's a beautiful and small restaurant. Small, simple, sweet and they continue to be my favorite. Big and bold flavors keep me coming back multiple times during the week.
author: Bay Area S.

description: Pretty decent Thai food-- not the best I've had, but good. Had the coconut soup (would have liked a bit spicier, but that's a matter of taste maybe) and also tried their signature noodle and pad see ew dishes.  Think this place fulfills any Thai craving satisfactorily.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here in terms of taste, but would potentially return.  Good customer service, very fast, and decent prices.
author: Ashley T.

description: My favorite place in San Francisco. Tasty food and drinks,  awesome stuff, you always can find place to seat inside. And if you are the lucky one and living or working close by to the place they have $10 business lunch menu. Thank you guys for being so awesome!
author: Olga N.

description: One of my complaints about ethnic food in San Francisco is that it's been hard to find places that will serve spicy food to white people. Admittedly, part of the problem is white people who don't like spicy food, and I must ask those people: "WHY THE HELL ARE YOU ORDERING THAI FOOD? OR INDIAN? GO EAT AT DENNY'S, FOR CRYING OUT LOUD!" Okay, having gotten that out of my system . . . I've been ordering from Chili Cha Cha 2 for a few years, and I've always been a fan of the food, but lately they seem to have upped their game as far as spiciness is concerned. The last time I ordered from them, I specified "Thai spicy" for the heat, and boy, did they deliver. The flavor balance was still good, with the garlic, basil, and umami of the beef coming through, and I found myself blinking through a sudden haze of endorphins and possibly tears . . . of joy, I assure you.
author: Bitter J.

description:
After confirming my ETA for an online order, I arrived to find they hadn't even started. They quoted me a second ETA, so I came back to stand around and wait 15 minutes past that second one when another customer showed up complaining of the same issue. 

After walking across a sidewalk reeking of urine stench six times, I had my food. I opened my spring rolls to find a thimble sized sweet and sour sauce, which made it 1/2 way through my first one of three. My tofu pad Thai came without tofu, and the faux chicken on it was like eating straight salt. 

If they'd been honest about the wait, remembered my tofu, and not chinced on the sauce, this would've been a five star experience. (I don't fault them for the salty fake meat, just not worth $2.)
author: dAvid s.

description: Had never eaten here before and ordered delivery through Eat24/Yelp. Food arrived earlier than expected which was great. Fish cakes were good, but nothing amazing. Praram was kind of lackluster and runny with a bitter peanut flavor. Just tasted a bit off.  Basic Thai offerings. Not worth repeating.
author: Charles L.

description: Wow...their food is really good. My fav is the yellow chicken curry.
author: Til B.

description:
Wow, this is the best Thai food I've ever had.

Veggie potstickers have an incredible sauce, the Thai iced coffee (ask for coconut milk!) tastes like a dark chocolate dream, and the pumpkin curry was spicy and delicious. This is an uncommonly good restaurant.

If you're a vegetarian and you haven't been here, you're only hurting yourself.
author: Maxx B.

description: 4 stars because they have the dopest lunch special. I go every Saturday for lunch, and while it's not the best thai food, it's one of the better thai places I've been to in SF and again, the dope lunch special....
author: Rhea M.

description: Meal arrived in the time frame indicated. The food was fresh and tasty upon delivery.
author: Joe R.

description: I came here on a Saturday night. Was able to sit immediately, about half the tables were filled, and the service was fast and attentive. I started with some ginger tea and followed with the Duck Curry with Brown Rice. Oh goodness is this a fantastic dish. A mild level of spice, a very complex mixture of sweet and succulent flavors. And it's really a great deal ($11 for a five star Thai dish in a nice atmosphere? Hell yes). I definitely will be back!
author: Josh S.

description:
Yes, it is surprising to see a Thai restaurant tucked away in a Latino neighborhood. Our waitress Noi was such a delight! Not only did she answer my questions about where they source their baby corn from, she also diligently suggested substitutions for my curry.

My husband and I started with the coconut milk soup, which was both delicious and surprisingly flavorful. We got the fresh spring rolls which came with the peanut sauce; the spring rolls were bursting with flavor and the peanut sauce made the perfect accompaniment. The green curry, although a bit watery, was perfectly simmered with my choice of veggies; the coconut rice I ordered with it was not as coconut-y as I'd expected (maybe I should have stuck with the usual jasmine rice?) My husband got the Penang curry with chicken, which he claimed is the best he's ever eaten. Needless to say, we left stuffed and smiling.

Can't wait to come back here!
author: Divya R.

description: Consistently tasty beautiful dishes. Fresh ingredients prepared spicy and delicious.  Friendly and attentive service. I highly recommend.
author: Antonio D.

description: Loved it! Big portions for a good price and the food is super good. I used to work at a Thai restaurant, so I can be pretty snooty and the food here is definitely on par. I live in Seattle and wish that I had this restaurant next to my house. Also my friend is vegan and they had lots of options and were super accommodating!
author: Andrea M.

description: I've tried a lot of panang curries I've the years - chili cha cha 2 has one of the best.
author: Alex S.

description: I order from this place a lot and they do vegetarian curries really well. They have multiple options such as vegetarian meat (seitan), tofu, or mixed vegetable varieties of their curries. Their curries are amazing and I recommend the Green Curry because it comes with eggplant that carries the flavor well. I frequently order from them, and recommend their fried rice (it's a bit on the oily side), and their panang curry as well.
author: Arjun M.

description:
This is my go-to Thai place, but that mostly has to do with proximity and the fact that I can place a to-go order online and it will be ready by the time I can walk there.

I usually get one of the curries. The yellow curry and pumpkin curry are my favorites so far, but pay attention to the fact that they don't come with rice and be sure to order that separately. I usually get the coconut rice, which gives it a slight sweetness.

I also tried the peanut noodle the other day, which was great, although I wish they would make the same dish on a bed of rice rather than noodles. (I haven't tried asking for this off-menu, but I may try next time.)

The only thing I've ordered here that I didn't like were the steamed veggies. I ordered them on the side once, but they come completely unseasoned, so they're very bland.

Overall, a solid Thai place.
author: Adam N.

description:
Delicious, legit Thai place with an 11 pm close time a block from my house - AMEN!

The frikkin green curry paste fried rice was delicious!

A new standard place - so psyched.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I called and said I would be eating from the restaurant. On arrival, my salad was already placed on a table. but I requested to be seated in a different spot.  The waitress then said, "Next time when you order, tell us where you want to sit so I don't have to move things twice." 
She said it rudely and she was clearly angry. This made me feel like getting up and walking away but my food was already in front of me so I stayed. If this is how customers are consistently treated, there is a lot that needs to change at the restaurant.

Here is my suggestion on this:
Consider waiting for the customer to arrive and once seated, bring the food over, rather than having him call and say, "Get me the fourth seat to the left of the entrance." Also, there is a chance someone might already be taking up that spot or anyone could arrive and sit there shortly after the call has been made.
author: Martin L.

description: Chili Cha Cha 2 is walking distance from my house, so I tend to frequent this place. Their service is always polite and welcoming. I usually order Tom Yum soup and they pay attention to any requests I might have. While the Tom Yum soup and Chilli Cha Cha Fried Rice is really good, their curries are just alright.
author: Gayathri N.

description:
(+): went back and had the chili cha cha fried rice, the ingredients were fresh and delicious. 

(-): i asked for "really spicy" because i'm constantly disappointed by spice level at most thai restaurants. chili cha cha was all like, "you got it, bitch." now i have fried rice that i'm pretty sure is explosive.

(0): go here because the food is good, but be careful what you wish for. game set match.
author: Siva M.

description: Loved the the service, very nice waitress. The good was delish, had the green curry chicken, and potstickers abd the banana and ice cream for dessert.
author: Claudia G.

description: My office has ordered from here about 5 times now and I'm consistently amazed at how good every dish is. It's not just tasty, there's something special about their dishes when compared to your average thai restaurant. It just tastes like actual thought and effort has gone into the making of every dish here - a rarity among not just thai restaurants, but restaurants in general.
author: Mike L.

description: Best place to get thai food in SF!  (Other than Farmhouse Thai Kitchen, which is amazing but a little pricier.)  Love the curries, the veggie basil thing, the papaya salad, and the spicy mango salad.
author: Erin B.

description:
I love Chili Cha Cha 2 and I eat here/get take out at least once a week. What happened today left a very bad taste in my mouth and I may never return which is unfortunate since the food is delicious. 

The place is down the block from my house, ordered in via Grubhub, left gratuity on credit card and waited for items to come. Delivery woman shows up and harasses me that I didn't tip enough, shoves food in my hand, and storms off. She also left off some topping ingredients for my papaya salad and no utensils. 

It's tax season, we're all on a crunch, sorry I didn't tip 15%+ for delivery that is 0.2 miles away but really!?!?! This literally is the hang out spot with my uncle once a week but we will be taking our business elsewhere. This is the only time I've tipped someone and gotten pretty much the finger for, which is ironic because looking at my last 6 grubhub orders are from CCC2.
author: Sara B.

description: So so good. Tastes like we're back in Thailand. The curries were amazing. The pad kee Mao. Omg. Nom nom nom.
author: Greg G.

description: Unfriendly waitstaff and sickeningly sweet food (tom kha and one of the curries). Nope. No thank you.
author: Josie L.

description: love this place!!! affordable and great customer service!
author: Raquel R.

description: Gone back several times now because it's close by and have had great experience. Reasonable price and tasty food. They finally improved on the rice...now it's more like on a dryer side...love the pad see yew and larb. Great neighborhood joint!
author: Xiu L.

description:
My cousin lives nearby here and suggested this place for lunch. I'm on a special diet right now, no sugar among other things.

They were able to easily take the sugar out of the stirfry sauce for the green beans. And it was still completely delicious! Also, they had brown rice. Which was important since I'm not eating white rice at the moment.

Would definitely enjoy eating here again when I'm in the neighborhood. The atmosphere was nice. It wasn't crowded on a weekday for lunch and it was easy to get in and out.
author: Mimi B.

description:
I love this place. My bf and I eat here almost every week. I think we've tried about 80% of the menue at this point. Good service, they recognize us, always very good and consistent food.

Best story I have is that we ate there once and I left my hat. We didn't go back for almost a month due to travel, and I couldn't figure out WHERE I had put my poor hat. I looked under the bed, in our couch, in my closet, everywhere. We stroll into this place after our long haitus, and before we can even sit down they present me with my long lost buddy! Horray! Thanks for remembering me chili cha cha!
author: Halley M.

description: Last Tuesday. My daughter and I are from South Bay and wanted to try something new. We were pleased with the vegetable pot stickers with Thai beer. I had the tofu green curry with brown rice on the side. Nice staff and comfortable surroundings.
author: J L.

description: I love this place.  Great, reliable food, and fast delivery.  I love the Tom Yum Soup ...
author: Daniel W.

description: This is one of the best Thai places in the mission. The food is great and fairly priced. The atmosphere is relaxed and casual. Highly recommend starting with the chicken pot stickers and a bowl of Tom yum soup. The Pad see yew is also a favorite. Highly recommend.
author: Allen M.

description: Reasonable prices ($50 for two people with an appetizer, a glass of wine each, and an entree each) but the food was just ok. Good option if you're in the area and looking for something affordable but I wouldn't seek it out. I had the Spring Rolls and Pad Thai with chicken and neither was bad or remarkable.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Finally! A Thai Restaurant on my street! And a good one too! It's always a good sign when you hear the staff and cook speaking the language of the cuisine they're cooking.
