I tried their specialty of Yellow Curry with Pumpkin which was a delicious twist on your standard Thai Yellow Curry...essentially swapping out potatoes with pumpkins. Spicy n' creamy!

I also had the peanut chicken fried rice after work one night...wasn't too bad...probably would've been better if it was eaten with another dish. 

The food was pretty good but the desserts were divine! The fried banana with ice cream especially made me loopy. I could eat that all day and all night (and die of a coronary...but with a smile on my face).
Khop Khun Khrap/Khaa (do NOT make that into an Acronym)

They do not serve alcohol at the moment but have applied for a licence to serve it...so it will soon. Spicy Thai food and lager! (Singha) Unbeatable combo!

The decor is decent and Thai themed. (10x better than the previous establishment which looked like a lavatory...to say nothing of the Panda Express quality pre-cooked food).

An interesting touch is having a widescreen HDTV...so it was possible for me to watch the SF Giants win against the Phillies (thus going to the "World" series). Come to think of it...I probably should have been paying more attention to my date than the telly...oops. Maybe they should show Thai programming instead (especially Muay Thai matches!!). That should provide a more appropriate atmosphere.

Good eats...affordable pricing...super convenient location (you can eat...then skip over to one of several nearby bars for drinks after). 
Street parking naturally on 24th Street. So if you're having lunch on Monday through to Saturday...bring quarters (or try to score a residential spot which should be good for 2 hours before you get a ticket).

If ya fancy some curry and lager (not yet but soon)...give this place a go. And PAY ATTENTION TO YOUR DATE!!
author: Rubeun T.

description: Food is pretty good. Service is wonderful, the servers are kind. I come here often and as they've gotten to know me, they do all kinds of little things to make me feel welcome.
author: Carrie L.

description: Pad Thai was a little too sweet. Papaya salad tasted nothing like papaya, it mostly tasted like vinegar.   Service is nice but not fast
author: Monica R.

description:
Best Thai food in the Mission!! Bacon wrap scallop appetizer is to die for. 
Also the Cheese Wontons are super delicious. Fish cake is so yummy.

Servers are very attentive and very friendly!! 
Definitely will go back again :)
author: Heather B.

description: This place is my favorite neighborhood Thai spot. The servers are nice, funny and do a great job. The food is affordable and delicious. Been here several times and haven't been disappointed. Good experience all around.
author: Brooks H.

description: love them! my fav dish is the crispy veg rolls. friendly and almost always much quicker delivery than promised.
author: JAllison M.

description:
This was the 2nd place I ever ate at on a date in my current relationship. Cannot speak a word of the language yet, but if this situation continues, I may never have to! (Still would like to try!)

Added plus: very close to BART, and not packed with peeps. Ironic for being on such a busy street, so it's more peaceful inside than you might think.
author: Garett T.

description: Their lunch special never disappoints. I like their pumpkin curry and their cashew curry. I've also had their Pad Se Ew for dinner and it was pretty awesome.
author: Vishal P.

description:
Chili Cha Cha's has the best lunch combo deal. (Full disclosure: I've only been in the restaurant twice.... I normally order online from Grubhub.) The Green Curry and Pad Thai are both excellent. What gets me to order again and again is the soup and appetizer deal. The chicken satay sticks are delicious. 

This is not the best Thai food in the city but it is cheap, convenient, and reasonably healthy. Perfect for lunch. (I think it's less than $10 for a main dish and two sides). The delivery is always fast and the employees are super polite.
author: Mel C.

description:
Im not a frequent poster...lets be real, Im just too lazy. Tonight (Friday) we ordered food for delivery and it came earlier than anticipated, and it was hot, delicious, and affordable. But let me tell you the best part! My husband had ordered a Thai ic
ed coffee that was forgotten by the delivery person. I called Chili Cha Cha and spoke with a supervisor? who hand delivered the ice coffee herself within 15min. Not only did she refuse a tip, but she also included a free dessert. We were blown away.
author: Iris L.

description:
S base.

Complicated database: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Essbase

Comprehensive dinner: Shredded salmon shrimp satay.

All of the above. But not at the same time.

Shredded papaya salad was generously sized and not over dressed. Fan of any culture who use fruit as a salad topping.

Salmon roll featured a crispy seaweed skin wrap that kept everything inside. Exterior worked well with the seafood interior. Really liked this.

Shrimp came as part of a pumpkin curry. Needed a little less oil and a little soft chunks of the the namesake. Just OK. Could have been better.

Satay consisted of four perfectly grilled skewers of spiced chicken. Comes with a rich and spicy homemade peanut sauce. Delicious alone or as a topping.

Interior is simple and unobtrusive and has the usual assortment of Thai accents. Staff was prompt and friendly. Prices very reasonable.

Statisticians love Essbase. Diners will likely enjoy the s bases here too.
author: Jason B.

description:
Delivery.
Got: lemongrass chicken, spicy basil beef (lunch), bacon loves scallop app.

The first two were quite similar and just waaaay too damn sweet for me.  The lunch thing just comes with a big glob of rice, decreasing the amt of meat.  

The bacon loves scallop dish was excellent though.  The sauce it comes with was glorious too.

Probably lots of good things on their menu, just not those.
author: Xue H.

description: My fave Thai spot in the mission. Such friendly staff, inexpensive prices and delicious food. The lemongrass sauté is the best!
author: Sivan G.

description: I ordered food delvered and specified no peanuts and requested utensils. No utensils and peanuts hidden in the corner of the container. Glad  I am not allergic to them!!!
author: Lydia V.

description:
My go to place for spicy food. I love their chili cha cha fried rice, tom yum soup, spicy eggplant with chicken and string beans with chicken. I found they use freshest veggies and don't over cook them like other restaurants. The veggies are always crunchy. And the staff is super friendly. Noi who works there is a sweet and friendly person. 

I found their prices very reasonable for the quality of food. Especially compared to far too many expensive restaurants with crappy food.
author: Su R.

description: This place never EVER disappoints! Amazing food cooked fast and great portions for a thai place. Did I mention they deliver?? oh and by the way: Favorite dish thus far is the Pumpkin Curry with Duck. You're welcome.
author: Jay B.

description: just got Tom Kha noodle soup, probably the best soup I've ever had! perfect for a cold rainy SF day, highly recommend :)
author: Mon M.

description:
The only Thai restaurant within a large area of the Mission (I miss you Suriyama). If you need Thai, you can go here or Pad Thai, which isn't significantly better or cheaper. So there's that to consider. 

I think a lot of people go out to eat and expect to have their minds blown, especially  Valencia Street diners. This is not that place. It's also not as expensive or trendy as those places, and for the money I think it's perfectly acceptable, perfectly agreeable Thai food. In other words, don't take your date here before you've had sex. Go to the place with the asses on the backs of their seats instead. That'll impress her.

I've eaten here 15+ times, both at the tables and to go, and it's not always consistent. Sometimes the chicken is tough, but it's always edible and never too greasy or nasty. Sometimes I ask for Thai Spicy and I get White Spicy. Sometimes (like last night), the spice level is hallucinogenic. Touche' Chili Cha Cha... 

The Tom Kha soup with noodles has yet to let me down, although sometimes it's better than others. I ordered the "Seafood Madness" one time and it was amazing - 5 different types of seafood, and none of them made me sick.

Also, you can't judge (or call yourself a fan of) Thai food if all you ever do is order Pad Thai. Even more points are lost if you bitch about the food being bland, but purposely order everything mild. The food here doesn't rely on grease, so you need the spice to get the flavor. Otherwise, you might as well go to Cheesecake Factory. I hear they've Thai for you there that is TO DIE FOR. 

This is a legitimate neighborhood spot. It's better than the Lemon Chili Lime place that used to be there, and it's saved my ass on many occasions from having to eat another burrito. It's not trying to impress you. It's not a destination for foodies. It's a utilitarian place for people who just want to get a good meal. By the way, the service is unpretentious and excellent, people are friendly, and there is no wait. Take that, Valencia Street!
author: Chris j.

description:
CCC2 was just as good as the Haight Street location when they first opened. In fact, some of the same people came over from Haight Street to work there. They were friendly, and the food was among the best Thai I've eaten.

We recently visited, after a long absence, and found that things weren't the same. The staff is completely different. I understand they have new owners. One by one, here's what went wrong -

1. It took 45 minutes to get our meal, when there were only 2 other parties in the restaurant. I did take notice, however, that they were churning out volumes of food for delivery. Seems like they should give some priority to the people who are sitting right in front of them, right???

2. Service was incredibly awkward. Our server refused to set any plates down on the table herself. Instead, she kept sticking them in front of me, until I'd finally grab it and do something with it.

3. Crab rangoons were major disappointment. They were basically soupy, overheated cream cheese with very little crabmeat. In fact, there was very little cream cheese too.

4. My wife's fried rice, which was supposed to come off the line spicy, and my wife asked for them to make it extra spicy, wasn't spicy at all. Not that they didn't pay attention to the special order (which they didn't), but they didn't make it the way it's supposed to come off the line.

5. Firecracker balls were tiny, slightly over-fried, had very little filling (not even sure what was in it this time), and not spicy. Hope they don't still refer to this as one of their signature dishes...

I don't know what happened to CCC2, but I hope they fix their problems soon.
author: Dave H.

description:
I went there with a couple friends. It was cozy and fun.
We had some wines (wine with Thai food, how's cool?) then we ordered crab fried rice and etc.. Oh! the thing called fired cracker was very good too, we ordered like 3 orders for the table LOL
author: Suga B.

description: Fantastic lunch special!! Appetizer, entree, and a side all for $10. Not to mention the quick and friendly service.
author: Kaitlin J.

description: The food was cheap but the pad thai I ordered was very under cooked and drenched in sauce.
author: Alex H.

description: Food here is pretty good but their delivery service is terrible. Late. Food cold. No acknowledgment
author: Caleb G.

description:
3.5 is right but I'll bump it up to 4 just because I've had many a positive experience here.

Let's talk food.  It's good, solid and consistent but not amazing.  The spicy string bean is a favorite as is the pad see ew.  Most of the noodles dishes you can't go wrong with and are done relatively well.  Again, while not amazing, credit must be given for consistently good.    

Chili Cha Cha isn't the best but eating here is usually pretty easy.  I've never had to wait for a table and so far everything I've ordered has come out in about 15 minutes or less.  The takeout procedure is pretty painless as well.  You can order everything online and pay, needing to do little else than sign a receipt upon pick-up.  This is a boon if you're on some serious deadlines and realized you haven't eaten since breakfast.

Again, quality is a 3 but consistency definitely pulls this towards the 4 range.
author: Steven R.

description:
I'm responsible for the often-tedious task of ordering lunch for the office, and I have had my share of bad experiences with delivery. However, Chili Cha Cha 2 (what kind of a name is this...) definitely restored my faith in humanity today.

I placed an order on GrubHub, and within 5-10 minutes received a call from one of the staff saying that they were unable to buy papaya from the market. Some might groan and complain that they still had the item on the menu blah blah, but with my string of luck with delivery, I was glad they even called to let me know -- much less so quickly after receiving the order!

I received another call at 12:20pm saying the order would be 15 minutes late, and it would arrive at 12:45 instead of the original ETA of 12:30. Eh, not a big deal. By 12:55, I was ready to give them a call but they showed up.... with four complementary Thai iced teas on the house! Awesome.

The food was decent, the pork in my Spicy Eggplant was a little dry and the coconut soup was not my favorite. But doesn't food just taste so much better when you're in a good mood? #truth.
author: Catherine C.

description:
So we were walking home from Dia de los Muertos the other night, and hungry. It was late, and my friend was worried that tacos would keep her up all night with ... um, tacos.

We walk past this nondescript-looking Thai place. Actually, it looked kinda descript - like a dump to be honest. But the menu looked OK and, did I mention we were hungry?

Fast forward 15 minutes to awed looks of happiness and mouth-wateringly delightful delectables. We ordered the spicy basil with eggplant and the pork ribs - and both were off the shizzle. Fresh lemongrass and chili clung to the perfectly-cooked ribs, and the eggplant was melt-in-your-mouth tender with crispy pieces of basil adding texture and sweetness.

On top of it all, the place was pretty packed for late on a Wednesday, and there was only one server, a young Thai lady, completely over-tasked -- and sweet as could be. She somehow managed to take good care of us, get us our food in short order, and be nice, even as she dealt with like 14 tables by herself, no exaggeration.

A hidden gem, this one. Ignore the decor and the 24th-street hipster dive ambience. This is genuine first-rate Thai food.
author: Mateo L.

description: This was good thai food. My chicken was under cooked a bit. It was eat able but I was a bit worried I would get sick. I would have had them cook it a bit more but I was on a quick lunch break and couldn't wait. Thankfully I am okay for now.
author: Goodguy M.

description:
I had dinner here last night with a friend and am still thinking about the potstickers, which were amazing. They are small and crispy, and topped with 3 different kinds of sauce.  Best potstickers ever. 

I also had the tornado beef which was delicious and came with a little brick of fried thin potato straws which made it even better. 

Based on the reviews I was kind of expecting the place to be kind of a dive, but it's actually clean and nicely decorated. The service felt a bit slow and they didn't bring out the courses for each of us at the same time (I got my soup first 5 minutes before my friend) but overall it was a good meal and I will be back.
author: Amy G.

description: Great thai food esp the chili cha cha rice and panang curry
author: Vicente C.

description: Sorry to give such a bad review, but this is seriously the worst Thai food I've eaten in a while. While I'm grateful they deliver, the beef pineapple fried rice and chicken satay I just ordered tasted...very nasty. The pineapple in the pineapple fried rice had NO flavor. Nada. It wasn't sour, it wasn't sweat, it almost tasted like...they took it out of the can and soaked it in water then washed in 10 times until it lost all its flavor and only has the appearance of pineapple. The fried rice itself had very little flavor. The meat did not taste fresh. The satay chicken was bland. I'm sorry, but this place won't get my orders again.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
YUM! 

Eat here for lunch! What a good deal; appetizer, side and main dish for $10.

I was introduced to CCC by a coworker. I was not sure about Thai in the mission at first, but this place was outstanding. Service was attentive and the 3 of us ordered, ate and were back in the office in an hour :-)

Salad, chicken satay and pumpkin curry (with brown rice) were my picks. I recommend that combo, and will return soon to try many more.
author: Hilda Z.

description:
Nice place with reasonable decor.  If you have friends who are particular, you can bring them here and not have to worry about them. 

Good flavor, service was pretty quick, and decent portions.
author: Elaine S.

description:
In an office full of picky...super picky eaters, IT'S A WINNER!

Consensus = everybody loved it.  

Shrimp and mango salad was so good, it melted in your mouth.
Chicken Potstickers - man that  triple decker sauce with the crispy edges...YUMMY!
Pumpkin soup - huh? I dunno but it tastes darn good to me.  I LOVE anything pumpkin or squash things...
Fresh spring roll with shrimp - FRESH!

We had this for lunch today at work ordering through seamlessweb for financial district delivery so I was nervous if they're going to make it on time for a noon delivery. They were 1/2 hour late BUT...it was worth it.  The food was excellent!
author: Grace D.

description:
How this place manages to put out the driest chicken in the world, I have no idea.  First time in my Pad Thai (like sandpaper), second time in my Tom Kha Noodle Soup (like a moth ball).  And how is dry chicken even possible in soup?  That's like the stupidest question ever.  

My second big tiff with this place is their Tom Kha soup.  It was totally flavorless - comparable to water.  I didn't even bother eating the rest of it because what is the point in eating a big bowl of water.   Please don't sell me water at $10 dollars a bowl.  I know this is America, but jeeze, come on.  

I won't be duped again.  Chili Bye Bye.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
I stand behind this restaurant!

To find a thai restaurant on 24th is exciting, but knowing that it's almost the same price as the alternatives in the hood, that the food is worthy of chai yo on polk st... Getting better already!

The cherry on the cake is how generous they are with portions. Not exactly your average high horse dining venue. 
Thanks cha cha
author: Adal B.

description:
Me: Hey what time are you guys open till?
CCC: 11, but last call is at 10:45
Me: great!

So at 10:05 I show up at the door and they're closed. 
This is what I get for having my heart set on Thai food in a neighborhood with no other Thai food:(

BOO.
author: Allie S.

description:
Wow, thank goodness they closed the horrible Chinese place and opened this wonderful Thai restaurant on lower 24th. I have been here 3 times now and still wonder why the place is not busier. My partner and I are vegetarian and the Tom Kha soup, the curry dishes, the vegetarian egg rolls and just about everything else we have tried have all been outstanding.
C'mon people of lower 24th neighborhood. Let's support this great Thai restaurant and keep some diversity with our food options in the hood!
author: Tim H.

description:
I REALLY wanted to like this place.  It's literally a block from my place, and I was hoping it could be my go-to spot when I need a Thai fix...but sadly, not the case.  Not only was it pricey, but the food made me and my fiancé spend the following morning, er, in and out of the bathroom incessantly.  

The food itself was decent enough...the Thai iced tea and the Anchor Steam beer we had at the counter while waiting for our food were enjoyable.  The décor is cute, and it looks like the restaurant seating is cozy and inviting.  We ordered a papaya salad, Tom Kha soup (bowl), shrimp Pad Thai, vegetarian yellow curry, and jasmine rice - all take out, eaten immediately upon getting home.  Out the door, we spent close to $50 - yikes.  For so-so food that gives me the runs?!  No thanks...won't be coming back here.
author: Jenna C.

description: They get my online takeout orders wrong pretty much constantly (seriously probably more than 50% of the time), but the food is decent and the price is right. Lunch special is a great deal.
author: Travis N.

description: A friend and I went here yesterday for dinner, and it was a solid, if not terribly exciting, place for Thai. The satay was tasty and the pad thai was okay. Nothing to write home about, but certainly a nice place to have around!
author: Tasha A.

description:
Didn't know what I wanted for dinner, and when I saw Thai here on Yelp it sounded good.  Chilli Cha Cha was conveniently located and I was very pleased with it.  Really nice server, nice ambiance, good food.  It wasn't mindblowing/best-ever Thai food, but it was really good.  I had the pad se-ew and my friend had the red curry, both were delicious and well worth it.  Also had the Firecracker Balls, which lived up to the hilarious name and were delicious.  Damn right I'm a sucker for fried sushi in spicy mayo.  

I'll be heading back and hopefully soon, so I guess that says it all.
author: Nate R.

description:
i came here one a wednesday afternoon and was the only one there. that was kind of nice. i really wanted thai food for some reason, even though i was in the mission. i had the veggie pad me kao, which was chopped up in chunks instead of left long like noodles. i didn't like that. there were lots of different kinds of veggies which was good, but there just didn't seem to be a good sauce. just some oil on the plate and kind of coating my food.

i also had the thai iced tea, which was good, but not great. service was decent, but maybe i stayed too long because i think she forgot i was there towards the end. haha. basically, not too bad, but not somewhere i'd go out of my way to come back to.
author: Kensey W.

description:
Ordered (delivery): 
1 Thai Iced Tea $ 2.95 - good, taped shut to avoid spills en route. They remembered to include the straw. 

1 Crispy Tofu Salad $ 7.95 - edible, not really a salad but a pile of fried tofu on a piece of iceberg with some shaved carrots and sliced onions for decoration. Dressing was tasty enough. 

1 Yellow Curry w/Chicken $ 9.95- they sent green curry, which while is not what I ordered was still something I eat, so I could live  with that. However, they serve it I guess by default super spicy, so I would order it extra mild if I had to eat there again.

1 Jasmine Rice $ 1.95 - decent, it's hard to mess this up. 


Overall: I wouldn't refuse to eat here, but I wouldn't go out of my way to to eat here again either. The thai iced tea seemed overpriced and the preparation of the food seemed like an afterthought.
author: Oly O.

description: I have no idea why this place isn't consistently rated 5 stars - easily some of the tastiest and freshest Thai food in the Mission, especially considering the price. I'm addicted to the pumpkin soup - only $5 for a large cup that's plenty for a light meal. Lots of great vegetarian and pescaderian options, and you can order a plate of stir fried veggies on the side to add an extra healthy kick to any order. Great spot!
author: Michelle I.

description: My husband and I ordered a numbers of items thinking we would bring the left overs to work the next day-- unfortunately for that plan the food was far too delicious-- and we are left sitting sluggish and satisfied with only empty plates and broken promises to show. But we would gladly do it again
author: Dei A.

description: I love this place. Their food is always delicious and the people working are always incredibly sweet. The sauces they use are probably some of the best I've ever had.
author: Melissa K.

description:
Well Done! Despite the creative spelling of "chili," Chilli Cha Cha absolutely exceeded my expectations.  This location is a definite step up from the one in the Lower Haight, which is pretty good in it's own way.

The interior is rather chic.  I love the bamboo on the wall.  They avoided  the gilded decor seen in a lot of Thai restaurants and kept things simple and elegant.  Thumbs up for the murals.

Service was good.  We ran out of water a few times but otherwise, I have no complaints.  The staff was attentive and very welcoming.

The best part, however was the food.  That's where Chilli Cha Cha knocked it out of the park.  Everything was so fresh and perfectly cooked.  The larb came on a beautiful bed of assorted baby greens.  We shared the Tom Ka which was just lovely.  The spring rolls were crunchy and almost like little rolled up salads.  The best thing was the pumpkin curry with lamb.  I didn't think lamb got that tender.  It melted in my mouth.  You could cut it with the edge of your fork.  BLISS!

I am so happy that they have opened on 24th Street.  I was also relieved to see the place fill up while we were eating. I was concerned about it being slow on a Friday.

As of this post, they do not yet have their liquor license.  The application was posted on the door.  They didn't mind us bringing our own bottle of wine, though.

Appetizer, soup, salad, entree and rice was enough for two, with leftovers. It came to $39.

++++++++++++++
Note, Feller Yelper David G tells me that in SE Asia, chili _is_ spelled with two l's.  Good to know and thanks!!  :)
author: Amy A.

description: Very inconsistent, both in service and food quality.  In particular, the duck was decent once, but mostly fat with hardly any meat the next time and stringy and tough the last and final time I'll ever get it.  Staff is sometimes unfriendly and frequently has communication issues over the phone.
author: Harlen W.

description:
It's aiight.

It's nice to have a Thai place amidst all the taquerias. Went here on a Friday night and most of the tables were taken, mainly by couples. Food is average, but I've had better Thai food. The price is reasonable but for what I paid, I've had bigger portions elsewhere. Service was fair, and the interior is nicer than what I would think just judging it from its external appearance. Nothing bad, but nothing made it stand out either. Still, a good addition to the Mission!
author: Zell C.

description: Tried C^3x2 just after moving to the neighborhood, I got the Tom Kha soup with tofu, which was the some of the best i've ever had in the city, also it was huge. Shannon B. got the green curry she was happy with her selection Jen L. got the Duck Curry "it was really good" she said, and I finished off with the Panang Curry which oddly was chocked full of what appeared to be both fresh and frozen vegetables but was still pretty tasty. As the other reviewers said, its prices are good, its open late, and its a mere 2 blocks from my house, can you get much better?
author: Jared Z.

description:
I feel a little hesitant to give such a new place such a poor rating.  In fact, I held off for a few weeks, but the current 4 star review is I think quite misleading and it seems from recent reviews that the food hasn't improved any since I was there.

Let me start off by saying that I really wanted to like this place.  It's super close to my house, and it would be awesome to have some cheap dinner options close-by that aren't burritos. 

The problem is not the service.  It's not the price point.  It's the food.  We had spring rolls, which tasted only of deep fryer and the dipping sauce was a spicy sweet chili sauce which also came with everything else we ordered.  We used it liberally on every dish to try to inject some much-needed flavor, but unfortunately 3 courses of sweet chili sauce gets a bit wearing on the old tastebuds.  I associate thai with really flavorful, savory dishes.  This place has a bit of tweaking to do before it gets there.

The menu is epically large.  I have a feeling some editing would improve the quality of the dishes.  Quality, not quantity, people!
author: Jane F.

description:
can someone play this for the owner and worker?
They don't know abou t this song

Chili Cha Cha which is a famous song in the 1970s in Asian
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wIVHiHG4nwc

sung by Jessica Jay, European Singer (2 singers used this name)

The restaurant #1 and #2 are 2 different owners
author: Sunny O.

description:
So, aside from my recent realization that pad Thai on the west coast is a world apart from the stuff we eat in Boston (that is to say, it's oddly sweet), I am pretty psyched.  I've done Foodler-ordered takeout from here, and I've eaten in, and both times were spectacular.  I think I prefer eating in though - the space is cozy, they've got Singha beer, and you don't have to pay a delivery fee :)

Minus 1 for having the TV on.  What's up with that?
author: Jillian Y.

description: I enjoy this spot. Really nice folks serving up good food (at a solid price). I have been here 10+ times.
author: Gina H.

description:
Delivery was right on time, in spite of cold, rainy weather. And, the restaurant called to double check the accuracy of part of the order we had placed on line.

Tom Kha Gai with noodles was fantastic. Flavorful, with lots of fresh chicken breast and big chunks of mushroom. The noodles came on the side, so that they stayed un-soggy, and were accompanied by a generous dollop of caramelized onions & garlic atop perfectly steamed Chinese broccoli.

Fresh spring rolls with tofu and shrimp were tasty, with fresh mint leaves and a not-too-sweet peanut dipping sauce. They had shredded lettuce inside rather than the rice vermicelli noodles that I'm accustomed to, but that didn't alter the flavor much. My only complaint was that they sliced the rolls into many pieces. While this made sharing very convenient, it also caused the rolls to fall apart; perhaps rice noodles inside would be more starchy and cohesive. We ended up eating the spring rolls with a fork, like a salad. But if that's our biggest problem in life, well... you know.

Panang curry w veggies & tofu was deliciously spicy and had a unique blend of vegetables; a little thinner sauce than would be my preference, but full of flavor nonetheless. We had it with brown rice, which was a tiny bit mushy. To be fair, that may have occurred in transit from the restaurant. The Pad See Ew with tofu was some of the best I've ever had. The tofu was lightly fried yet still soft on the inside - not rubbery. Lots of egg and Chinese broccoli in it, too. 

Will definitely order from CCC2 again! Thanks for the great meal.
author: Laura G.

description:
I think this is my second favorite cheap thai restaurant ever (the favorite being Pam Real Thai in New York City)

Went to CCC2 on a Friday night. The dining room was largely empty, which is a pity, because it was a pleasant space. We did see a bunch of people get takeout, though.

I had a papaya salad and the pad see-ew. I asked for both of them spicy, and they came out flavorful and with a good amout of bite. The papaya has clearly been marinaded in the dressing; a lot of the crappier thai places just piur the dressing on top when you order it.  My husband had a tom yum soup and panang curry with salmon and avocado off the daily specials, and both were really tasty. 

It's 2 blocks from my house; so glad they opened!
author: Jenny B.

description:
I loooooove this place! I always order online from work to pick up (I work nearby) or from home for delivery. The staff is always super nice. When you order online they send you an email immediately letting you know they got your order, and they call when they arrive with your delivery. I usually order yellow or pumpkin curry with chicken(sometimes salmon), chicken sa-tay and Thai iced tea. Delicious! Just remember to order rice with your curry because it doesn't come as part of the meal. I'm picky and never eat leftovers but that curry remains amazing even after a day or two in the refrigerator. 
Definitely my favorite go-to Thai place in SF right now.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Nice new thai option in the neighborhood.  They have the usual pad thai and curry fares.  But there were a couple of unique dishes, in particular, the the soft shell crab with yellow curry powder (yummy!), the BBQ short ribs (ok, seems more Korean than Thai) and the lamb curry with pumpkin (good).

Their liquor license is pending but in the meantime, you can go down to the nearby liquor store for some BYOB.
author: F. P.

description: The best crab rangoon I've ever had --anywhere in the country. Cannot describe how delicate the pastry and overall how flavorable it was! Also unbelievably good pumpkin soup! And super yummy spicy green beans with beef. Additionally, the food was delivered not only warm, but HOT!
author: Swiss C.

description: The quality of the food is impressive, given it is delivery!  Every order has arrived piping hot, with great cuts of meat.
author: Sam G.

description: very good no frills thai place. They also know what spicy means and are good with substitutions as well!
author: Brian V.

description: went at lunch time to try their lunch special. had their coconut soup, chicken potstickers and chicken pad thai.. chicken potstickers were decent but overall food was too sweet even when asked for spicy (i tried the chicken pad thai). the soup had a nice coconut flavor but the veggies in there seemed like they came from a frozen veggies pack. service was good though but food wasn't good enough for me to try this place again.
author: Vijith N.

description: Consistently good food, I've always ever done takeout and they're super nice, remember me and it's ready within 10 minutes.
author: Charlie H.

description:
CCC2 is a fantastic little Thai place in the heart of burrito alley. The restaurant is well-spaced and nicely decorated, and the staff are friendly and attentive.

What about the food? The spicy pan fried noodles and fried garlic and pepper beef are both winners, and the Thai iced tea is perfect.

Most dishes are around $8-10, so for two people a meal will probably run around $30 or so, depending on whether you get dessert. (which you should, because the fried bananas with ice cream and sweet sticky rice with mango are both awesome)

I've only been once so far, but I'll definitely be back again soon!
author: Nick S.

description: The food was really good compare to what you pay for. The portion is big and servers are attentive. My water was never empty and didn't even notice when they came and filled it for me.
author: Daisy S.

description: Pretty tasty Thai food lost amongst taquerias in the heart of the Mission. The vegetable panaang curry is damn good. The coconut rice was a bit bland but certainly didn't take away from the rest of the meal.
author: Priscilla M.

description: Good food, good price, nice people. Vegetarian options galore. I've been here a couple of times, and it's the nice thai food place around the corner that isn't too greasy and isn't too expensive.
author: Molly R.

description:
The good:
fast
easy to order both eat in and take out
flavorful
if you specify that you really want a dish spicy, it will come really spicy
super friendly staff
the pineapple fried rice is packed with pineapple, cashews, chicken and shrimp
the garlic and pepper veggies (hold the tofu) are intensely garlicy 
free delivery

The bad:
a bit too oily
all the to-go food is packed in plastic - no paper or compostables, just straight up plastic containers, plastic lids, plastic bags.
not cheap. not expensive either but certainly not cheap.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Thai food in the mission is hard to find. But once you get of the street of drunken latinos and pee smell this place is a gem.  They have great portions and the Pad-se-Ew is great. And Im an expert.  Get it with chicken and thank me later.
author: Joseph M.

description: This place is a gem- and I'm only recommending the dish I had...pumpkin curry lunch special. That's it! It was the most wonderful curry explosion of mouth watering goodness. My friend and I could not stop eating it all even though we were so full. Just the right amount of sweet savory and a bit of spice. But the best part was the milky texture of the soup combined with the soft melt in your mouth pumpkin squash...oh yes, I've been dying for another chance to go back and try this dish again. I assure you, I've had lots of curries, but this was my favorite squash one. The funny part was that I passed by this place and never noticed it. It's small from the outside, but much more classy and clean from the inside. Just a few blocks from the Bart. If you're craving thai for lunch and you're in the area, this is definitely a must try place. And if you like yellow curry, then you'll love this pumpkin one as much as I did! Definitely keep an eye out for this place :)
author: Rayne W.

description: Not bad! I discovered Chili Cha Cha 2 one night when I had a craving for Thai and my normal go-to for takeout, Osha, told me they were done with delivery orders for the evening (boo!). Grubhub led me to this place -- which delivered until 11:00 p.m. at the time (though the website now suggests otherwise). The portions were more than generous -- there is definitely enough for leftovers -- and the green curry I ordered was excellent (as were our spring rolls). The chicken and vegetables in the curry were not the best I have had, but for the price (less than the usual for a large portion), the food was great, and it arrived practically right as I hung up the phone. I can't complain -- I was very pleasantly surprised, and I have ordered from this place quite a few times since.
author: Katie M.

description: I've tried this place a couple times, both sit-in and take-out. I want everything to be a dollar less, as there wasn't anything particularly memorable about any dish.  I did really appreciate our waitress though, and liked that they were trying for some ambience and mood lighting.
author: Lily S.

description: Tried to order online.  An hour after my order went through supposedly I got an email saying the order was cancelled.   I never got my food.
author: Bumpus H.

description:
Bad customer service!

My friend and I went there on Saturday Dec. 2 2011, to order food to go for 5 people. Our bill came up to a bit above $75. 

The moment we paid, I remembered that I forgot a soda for one other person. I ordered two and handed the waitress a credit card. 

She told me that the minimum payment for the credit card is $10.00. But we just spent $75!!! I said. Nope, it has to be in one transaction.

She refused to void the previous transaction and re-ring it again with the soda included. She refused to accept the cc for the 2 sodas in the amount of less than $10.00. She refused to cancell everything and give us money back. We basically had to go to the bank, to withdraw cash and pay for the sodas.

THEN, while she promised food to be ready in 25 minutes, her lack of organization caused us to wait AN HOUR!!!

There were 9 people in the whole restaurant, and only 2 received their food in the 1 our we waited for ours. 

Seems like the place is disorganized. And he fact that we were spending $75 and were not able to pay additional $5 on the cc, is ridiculous.

Will not go back there again!
author: Pete B.

description:
Very clean space. The people who serve are very nice. I have had the pad thai and the panag chicken ( both great. )

Please try the fried banana & vanilla ice cream !!! hands down so good.
author: s s.

description: Had the Spicy Basil w/chicken lunch special...great flavor, fresh steamed rice but the veggie spring rolls were bland and it needed dipping sauce. I would have given 4 stars but I ordered to go and it took an hour instead of the 30-45 min as advertised. I would definitely go back but I would opt to eat in.
author: tOnii e.

description: Friendly staff but expensive. I feel like it's my only resort for Thai food in my neighborhood without paying over $20 a meal. I really wish their curry wasn't so waters and I wish that their pumpkin curry taste like pumpkin curry.
author: Melissa O.

description:
I didn't like the food at all. I ordered a spicy Tofu vegetable and a portion of Jasmine rice to go. 

The container wasn't great to keep the sauce inside it. When I reached home it was half spilled out and I just live 2 blocks from the place. 

The tofu didn't taste anything. It wasn't spicy at all and was low on salt and other spice. The portions were not great too. 

My roommate to visited the place during Grand Opening and even she didn't like the place.
author: Kapil D.

description: Got off late from work and just needed food and a beer... tried this place on a whim and was truly (and pleasantly) surprised at how good the food was. Had the beef ribs with sticky rice and pad thai and would order both again in a heartbeat... fast, friendly and decent pricing. This is my new Thai takeaway place. Went in tired and grumpy, left happy and quite satisfied.
author: Richard F.

description: This restaurant looks a little iffy from the outside but is wonderful! The food is excellent, the portions are large and the price is right. The place is nicely decorated, clean and has a great overall ambiance.
author: Brooke B.

description: Quite possibly the worst Thai food I've ever had. Bad enough that, when ordered as take out last night, we stopped eating it, even though still hungry. Granted we ordered close to closing time, but pad see ew with super thin egg noodles and no flavor does not make for good eats.
author: Jordan Y.

description:
pretty tasty food, i was mostly impressed with the server, there was only one server on and she really took care of us well even though she had other tables and a whole lot of to go orders.
my boyfriend had the firecracker balls or something like that, deep fried ahi tuna rolls and they were FANTASTIC!
author: Jasmine F.

description: Chicken noodle soup with flat rice noodles. Spot-hitter, especially if you're trying to kick a cold's butt.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I've only ordered delivery from these guys and it's been consistently good.  The food comes prompt, hot and unlike a lot of the places I order delivery from nowadays...the portions are decent.  Enough to have left overs at least!   I like their basil chicken, chilli cha cha fried rice with chicken is off the hook, spicy string beans & pad see eu.  It's not cheap but living in SF has me trained to ignore that.
author: Ramon L.

description: I have been here about three times, once for take out and love their pumpkin lamb curry and the banana rolls dessert.  I have also had other dishes, like the pad see ewe and I have tried something with duck and other two dishes with eggplant and green beans.  I did feel that it was a bit pricey because they have pretty small servings but it is savory.  The service is pretty good, nothing really to gripe about
author: Melody U.

description: It was a gem! Everyone is right! Loved the green curry and the Tom Yum soup! We were looking for somewhere to eat and it wasn't busy so we popped in and are so glad we did! :)
author: Jordan F.

description: We've ordered delivery from here. The delivery time is reasonable (30 to 45 minutes) and the online system easy to use. We've only gotten curries so far and they are tasty but nothing with a wow factor.  One thing that bothers me though is the price of rice.  We paid $4 for a tiny little thing of rice, like the smallest take-out carton there is.  That just seems morally wrong! It's rice... it should be like a dollar or dollar-fifty a person and there should be A LOT per person. Next time I'll make the rice at home.
author: Jillian R.

description: Cute and clean with a friendly staff and one particularly secluded inset booth that would be great for a date. Food comes out fast, hot and flavorful. I can't find a reason to complain.
author: Quinn S.

description:
After passing around a few spliffatonis and downing some coors light we went to this place last night and I almost lost my mind.The panang avocado with salmon was insane and the pumpkin curry with lamb was pretty damn good too, as well as everything else we ordered (and we ordered a lot). In fact i liked it so much that i created a yelp account soley for the purpose of this review. 
Pretty excited to have a good thai place right by my house, even though mexican is still my number 1...
author: Dustin W.

description: Meals here are always delicious, the atmosphere is nice and service is excellent! We come here whenever we get a craving for great Thai food.
author: Ian N.

description:
I eat here a lot (it's 15 steps from my door). The pad thai is pretty darn good as are most things on the menu, however, the curry is very hit or miss (duck can be awesome or way too fatty and terrible).  When I first started coming here, I ordered my meals "spicy" and was disappointed until I told them I mean really, really spicy. That did the trick. The space is clean and well lighted, but somewhat standard when it comes to decor. Also, they need to do something about the front door, it doesn't close on its own and leaks cold air into the first couple rows of tables. 

Overall, this is a great place to order out pad thai but a little less awesome for eating in.
author: Evan S.

description: Ordered for the first time, based on good reviews. This is for their takeout service. Ordered on Eat24 a few days in advance and came about 20 minutes after the pick-up time, and they didn't have my order ready. They didn't even make it yet. Had to wait another 15+ minutes for the order. -- When opening the food container @ home, the portion of food was just under 1/2 the container (eggplant dish) that had maybe 5-6 pieces of eggplant. $10 for that amount of food is ridiculous, especially for an order not made on time and making the customer wait. Won't order from here again!
author: M s.

description:
last sunday's weather made for a lazy night in for our sunday dinner group.  we opted for take away and mindless horror flicks, fitting for this month's festivities.  after idle indecisiveness, we agreed to try the new resto on the block: chilli cha cha -- 1 block from j&l's pad and my work as well.  

me: basil chicken
l: chicken pad se-eu
j: tofu chilli cha cha fried rice

i thought that j's rice was delicious.  they flavor the rice so well, and it was simply amazing w/the veg and tofu.  l's noodles were tasty, and i loved the broccoli in it.  my dish was ok.  i was expecting minced chicken, and it turned out to be big chunks of chicken.  the flavor was still good.  

all in all they do thai right, and is a great addition to the hustle and bustle of 24th street.
author: Sheri N.

description:
they have these vegetarian potstickers that are covered in a combination of three different sauces that i would literally solidify into a deodorant so i could wear it everyday.  i think it's a combination of sriracha, hot mustard and then this brown sauce and this combination - plus the crispy edges of the potstickers and steamed middle - is heaven.

the pad thai is good, too.  i've gotten a few other things but i am happy with the vegetarian potstickers and pad thai.

CCC2 is close enough for me to walk to so i can't speak to their delivery services, but i have dined in and have gone in to order out.

+ clean restaurant / cute decor
+ friendly waitresses
+ prompt arrival of food when i walk in off the street and order to go (and sometimes i'll get a free thai iced tea while i wait)
author: Lauren P.

description: Every time I have gone in here I have had good service and great food!!  I ask about how things are cooked prepared if I am not sure about the dish.   There is a language barrier so make sure they understand with how you want things prepared.  Ex springs rolls you don't want fried they will be more than happy to prepare the food how you want.  Don't be shy to ask and say what you need and they will take care of you!
author: gayle w.

description: Decent restaurant overall but I really stick to one dish, the amazing salmon avocado Curry (coconut) dish. WOW. I recommend it everyone, just be careful because "extra spicy" really does mean EXTRA spicy.
author: Mark C.

description:
Stopped by on a whim and we loved it.  The guys had noodle with peanut sauce and they loved it so much that they ordered another helping.

Pumpkin curry was as good as the one from OSHA (maybe better)

Great jasmine rice

Mango sticky rice good, but not the best I've ever had.

We got there early so we sat in the cozy booth.  Service excellent.

We'll be back
author: Brenda B.

description: Really want to like this place more as it's a block away and happy to have fresh alternatives to Mexican fare, but the food's been consistently meh. Not bad, just not special. I'll keep going back for convenience sake, but it's not a destination for me.
author: Joshua S.

description: I ordered Pad Thai and spring rolls.  I mean, the pad thai is OK, but they only give you sporks to eat with (to-go).  The spring rolls were hands down the worst I've ever had.  I think they're just not their specialty.  They just taste like lettuce.  I mean... I see something else in there, but I can't taste it.
author: Cameron J.

description: Worst coconut soup I've ever had. It tasted like I was drinking some kind of sweet, syrupy dessert. There were all of 2 ingredients in the thing--shrimp and mushrooms--and there were hardly any of those! I should've made an omelet.
author: franny p.

description: Thanks for opening a Thai food place so close to our house!  I wish you the best.  I think this will fit the bill when we're too lazy to walk all the way to Manivahn.  But, I must say that unfortunately the curries ands soups are a little sweet, and the calamari salad is just ok.  The ginger fantasy chicken is amazing, we'll get that every time.  Keep it up, CCC2 - a few little tweaks and this may just work out.
author: Julie L.

description: Increased the delivery minmum from 15 to 20 Ive been going to this place since it opened, but still coudnt make any exceptions n was rude about.
author: Jamar t.

description:
Best Tom Kha I've ever had. 

Trying Chili Cha Cha's Tom Kha made me fall in love with the dish (Spicy coconut soup with mushrooms and seafood, etc) So I tried to find a comparable experience to what I had found here. No dice. 

Everything else I've tried here is top notch, and definitely love its fried calamari and Pad Thai. That said, I keep going back to the Tom Kha with combination seafood and steamed rice noodles. 

I mostly get delivery but every time I've dined in, it's been a great experience.
author: blake s.

description:
I've had a few delivery experiences here and it's just not that great. I really wanted to like Chilli Cha Cha.. but really, the food is pretty mediocre.

The first time I got chicken and noodels in peanut sauce. The sauce was way too thick. 

The second time I got som tam salad and crispy tofu. The tofu was soggy and the salad had way too much fish sauce. 

So.. eeeh. It's edible and they deliver pretty fast... but eeeeh.
author: A K.

description:
I loved the original Chili Cha Cha in the Lower Haight and was a regular customer when I lived there. So I was thrilled to see that they were opening up a location in the Mission 2 blocks from my house. Sadly, the food is just not the same quality. I think they might have also increased the prices a bit. Its still decently priced but the other Chili Cha Cha was an absurdly good deal and the food was much better. This is just so-so Thai food in a city with many excellent Thai restaurants.

Since they have not competition in the immediate area, I'm hoping they'll stick around. But if you want good Thai, make the journey to the inner Mission or Noe Valley or somewhere else. Chili Cha Cha is a convenient after-work dinner pickup but the food is nothing to write home about.
author: Audrey L.

description: One word comes to my mind to describe this place: cute! rather small, well hidden, cheap and "young". Despite the restaurant size, the menu is huge and I had to let my gf order long before I could decide what to take, but I'm also a special case :-)   After an almost endless deliberation, I opted for a clay pot with seafood (only shrimps and calamari rings), cabbage and soya noodles which was tasty, a little spicy and with a strong garlic flavour.  I honestly found a bit disappointing the calamari rings that you could have hardly distinguish from ... plastic. The dessert, sticky rice with vanilla ice cream was decent but nothing memorable. The service was good.  Not striking enough to make me a fan...
author: Andrea L.

description: Just wanted to order some tom kha soup and a salad from grub hub. Hadn't heard of this place before but like to support neighborhood businesses. Unfortunately, it was so bad. The tom kha soup was cloying sweet and had cabbage and baby corn in it. Definitely not the authentic tom kha I was looking forward to. The second dish was missing a main ingredient and covered in a super sugary sauce. Wish I wouldn't have tipped 25% without knowing. Perhaps they felt that they no longer had to care. Oh well, now I know. Definitely won't order from here again.
author: Katie M.

description: Just spent $7.40 on an eggplant meal here. Being that I am broke I was indeed trying to get something affordable on the menu. The serving size was literally laughable. It was double wrapped in plastic bags (my girlfriend also asked for no bag) to hide how sincerely pathetic the amount of food was. It tasted great, but I was so upset that that much money couldn't even afford it to be over rice or with tofu. Never again. I liked he waitresses there too. Too bad.
author: D. Alexander H.

description: I love finally having a thai place on the 24th St side of the Mission, so I went in prepared to forgive a lot if necessary - but it wasn't. The food is good, the decor is nice, the waiter was sweet, answered our questions and kept our water glasses full. They say they can make most of their dishes vegetarian - I haven't tested this too hard, but I really appreciate that they make it clear. Most importantly, the avocado curry was delicious.
author: Lana O.

description:
Last week,My friend and I went there five minutes before 11pm. they staff was still happy to serve us. Actually, I wanted to try their special lunch combo which my friend is so in love with. Unfortunately, I got back in town late. Anyway, I'm glad that I did go to have dinner there.Well,We started with chicken pot stickers and fire cracker balls OMG those was YUMMY!! I ordered grilled salmon because I wanted to have something light.Grilled salmon served with veggies.It was so delicious and I feel healthy. My friend had their steak come with thai-style dipping sauce. Looked so great but I didn't try tho.My friend said that was tender and juicy. Our dessert was Fried banana and coconut ice cream which was so good. 



Nice place.Great taste 

The service is always extremely warm and friendly.
Portion is feeling.
I love their food presentation.those are outstanding

definitely this is my thai place .
author: Kimberly J.

description: It's less than mediocre Thai food.  This is the third chance I gave them to get it right, and it was worse than ever.  Way overcooked rice noodles, and tasteless.  Basically I got a bland soggy mess with scant Chinese broccoli.   Thursday night and the place was empty - that should have been a clue.  Boo.
author: Nancy V.

description: Friendly staff, quick service, great food. 5-stars, easy.
author: Austin C.

description: Solid food. I got the lunch special (chicken satay + yellow pork curry) and a thai iced tea. The appetizer coconut milk based soup was surprisingly good. I need to sample more items before I can go lower or higher than a 3, but the lunch special was only ten bucks which  seems reasonable.
author: Adam K.

description: I read the reviews claiming flavorless, but decided to perservere. So happy I did! This is a wonderful, clean, tasty family run gem in the heart of the mission. The lunch special will be my new go to when working from home. And I am a spice flavor junky... whom thought everything was quite flavorful.
author: Rebecca P.

description: My girlfriend and I have been here twice and it's consistantly been hell-yeah awesome.  Pad thai, tofu with peanut sauce, duck curry--it's just great.  And oh man you should get the firecracker balls appetizer.  Good prices (though we always end up spending a lot because we order so much), good thai iced coffee, I could go on and on.  Check it out
author: Charlie E.

description: yellow curry and pumpkin curries were good. the peanut noodles were gross. the portion was also small for what we paid, but since it was gross that was fine. i'd recommend sticking to the curries.
author: E K.
